data.name: Montclair Shakespeare Series

info.description: Montclair Shakespeare SeriesThe Montclair Shakespeare Series will be a free Shakespeare concert reading series designed to bring classical theatre to the Montclair community. The program will kick off with a one-night-only staged reading of a play accompanied by live acoustic music, concluding with a possible discussion of play with audience members. The night will he held in a historic venue in Montclair, and is meant to be kept "no frills," needing only actors to bring the words to life.  Both local artists and established AEA professionals from NYC have volunteered their time to perform. We begin with Twelfth Night at the end of May 2015 (to hopefully be included in the festivities of 'May in Montclair'), and the goal is to eventually make the series an ongoing one, featuring a different play each month or so. This is celebration of Shakespeare's work and the cultural community of Montclair, which has always had an appreciation for the arts, but currently has little professional theatre available.The series will follow a similar format to that of Project Shaw, a popular staged reading series based in NYC (http://gingoldgroup.com/) but will focus on the work of William Shakespeare.In a concert-style staged reading, plays are read by the actors with the script in hand with very limited staging. The emphasis is on the language and on the actors' ability to bring the characters to life without costumes, sets, or movement. How You Will HelpDonations/Funding will help us secure a suitable venue for the series (Montclair Women's Club, Van Vleck House & Gardens, the Commonwealth Club, among others, are under consideration). Donations will also contribute toward the travel stipends required for Actors' Equity Association members coming to Montclair from NYC to perform. This ensures that we can have the highest caliber professional talent involved in this project. Our goal is to continue this reading series and potentially register as a non profit organization in the future. In doing so, we can expand our programming and outreach. Your donations will help us as we launch ourselves!
info.risks and challenges: Launching a theatre project is an extremely difficult task, and many companies have struggled to stay afloat in Montclair due to high venue rents and expenses. It is our goal to finally find a way bring theatre to this community at a low cost. We are in communication with the Montclair Public Library and the Van Vleck House & Gardens as we look for a home for this series moving forward into the future, and it is our hope that their support will make all the difference!/Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

data.blurb: The Series will consist of free staged readings of Shakespeare's plays, brought to life by professional actors in Montclair, NJ.

data.name: Only Forever at The Hope Theatre

info.description: About us...Tangled Thread Theatre Ltd. is a new theatre company dedicated to promoting and developing new writing and new talent in theatre. We have recently joined Equity's Professionally Made Professionally Paid campaign, becoming one of the first theatre companies to sign an in-house agreement with the union, committing ourselves to fair pay for all actors and creatives working on our projects. This is particularly important for us, as we hope to use almost entirely new graduates for all of our productions, providing them with crucial paid work and an opportunity to showcase their talents early in their career without having to pay for it or work for free.Our first production, 'Close To You', explored body image and the notion of fame in young women. It premiered at the Edinburgh Festival Fringe, receiving 5 star reviews, securing us a limited tour and a transfer to the Southwark Playhouse in London.Our next project is a brilliant piece of new writing by young playwright Abrahan Arsis, exploring the psychology of family. 'Only Forever' is a claustrophobic and intense play that asks audiences how far you would go to protect your family. We have just secured a venue for the play at The Hope Theatre in Islington, and have started putting together a talented company of young creatives to direct and design the show, and will soon start looking for the perfect cast from the many actors graduating form Drama Schools this Summer.As a new company we are currently dependant on financial support to enable us to pay all of our company properly and still put on a thrilling and exciting show that audiences will love.What we will spend it our funding on...The majority of our budget will be spent on our Cast and Creative's salaries as we are committed to paying everyone who works with us a fair wage for their talent! But there is still plenty more to spend money on...Cast and Stage Manager salaries = £3899.50Creatives/Crew salaries = £1170Marketing = £500Costume/Props/Set = £400Insurance = £100Reserve (for any scary surprises) = £500
info.risks and challenges: Our biggest challenge is going to be raising the funds to pay our company. However it is paramount for us that no-one will be underpaid, and undervalued for the work they provide. We are 100% committed to fulfilling this promise./Theatre is a risky business, but that is what makes it so engaging and exciting...so while there may be risks in our process, we will be relishing in them!/Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

data.blurb: An intense new play exploring how far you would go to protect your family.  Employing new graduates to give their careers a kickstart.

data.name: Peter Pan by J.M. Barrie @ Open Space Arts

info.description: Fairies. Pirates.  Mermaids.  And a boy who can never grow up?  J.M. Barrie's classic story has stuck with us for almost a century, and now Open Space Arts would like to put their own spin on this landmark play.Open Space Arts is a 25 year old non-profit community theatre in Reisterstown, Maryland committed to bringing families together through low cost and accessible art.  We believe that art should be for everyone.  Last year, we successfully funded our art nouevea inspired production of A Midsummer Night's Dream.  This year, we need help in continuing to produce high quality theatre for the community. With your help, we can create a beautiful and memorable Peter Pan that will delight audiences and give people a chance to create theatre together.While we have set our minimum goal at $1,000, our ultimate goal is to raise $4,000 to cover all of the costs of the production.If we reach $2,000... we will throw an opening night reception for our backers with cake and other delicious goodies.If we reach $3,000...we will send an exclusive backstage video to all of our backers.If we reach $4,000... all of our backers will receive an Open Space Arts button!We will be performing Peter Pan at the St. Mary's Theater in Hampden, MD on February 20th, 21st, and 22nd.  Thank you for helping Open Space Arts!  We will see you in Neverland.Can't come to the show?  No problem. We have provided some great reward incentives to those who do not live in the Baltimore area.  Please read each reward description carefully.
info.risks and challenges: Theatre can be a challenging business but we know that our experience as artists will help us overcome any challenge. One setback might be time management. We have a lot of costumes and props to make. We also are working with a very small budget and may find our funds don't quite fit our needs. However, we have a group of very dedicated volunteers who will stop at nothing to get things done. We have years of experience working with time and money constraints. The community we have built is a strong one and we have overcome so many obstacles as an organization. We know we will be able to complete this project no matter what./Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

data.blurb: Help a non-profit community theatre create an unforgettable production of J.M. Barrie's classic play.

data.name: The Collector, a play by Daniel Wade

info.description: Underdog Theatre Productions presents the world premiere of //////About The Collector: /What makes a man? How would you cope with the loss of a brother? How far would you go for revenge? /...and afterward, how would you forgive yourself?/Ushering in the 20th anniversary year of The New Theatre, Temple Bar, Dublin, The Collector is a dark thriller of regret, retribution and broken masculinity. /Frank Collins is dead at twenty-three, and his brother Oren knows who to blame. On the run from a ruthless loan shark and his own crimes, Oren Collins has just one night to repay all wrongs. Ignoring the warnings of his uncle Des, manager of the seedy Dark Horse Pool Academy, Oren holes up in the back room for a final confrontation with Joseph, the visiting American lecturer who cast a shadow over Frank's final months. As the three men make discoveries about each other, The Collector simmers to a disquieting conclusion. /The cast for The Collector is: Graeme Coughlan (Hamlet, Mill Theatre Dundrum, "Wrecking the Rising"), Will Murphy (A Storm in Swords, Beckett Theatre, Caitiff, The Mart), Michael Heavey (Food of Love, Angels in the Park, "The Old Secret") Kevin Brennan ("Love/Hate", "Damo and Ivor") and Joseph Duggan (“Vikings”, “Secrets of Great British Castles”). //////Writer: Daniel Wade  //  Director: Cian Ó Ceallacháin  //  Photography: Killian Whyte  //  Stage Manager: Deirdre J Lynam  //  Lighting Design: Colm Horan  //  Sound Design/Original Music: Linda Walsh//Performances: /Shows daily (except Sunday) at 7.30pm from 23 Jan - 4 Feb 2017 The New Theatre, Temple Bar, DublinTickets €16 general admission; sales opening soon at http://bit.ly/2eEEblL  Box Office opens at noon (enter inside The Connolly Bookshop)/No Late Seating/Run time - 70 minutes no intermission/Parents be advised; contains strong language/The New Theatre is located at 43 East Essex St, Temple Bar, Dublin 2For more information, visit www.thenewtheatre.com. /About Underdog Theatre Productions: The Collector is our 8th world premiere production since our founding in 2011. Some past productions include Waiting for Garda by Cian Ó Ceallacháin, Caitiff by Kevin Whelan, and Tingo by Jessie Doyle and Cian Ó Ceallacháin./About The New Theatre, Temple Bar, Dublin: The New Theatre is a 66-seat theatre housed in one of the oldest historic buildings in Temple Bar. The present state-of-the-art theatre venue was constructed in collaboration with Wallace Construction and Connolly Books and launched in 2007 in conjunction with the Theatre's tenth anniversary. The New Theatre is Ireland's only new writing theatre and actively supports the development of new and emerging writers. Under the guidance of Artistic Director / Theatre Manager Anthony Fox, productions have met with critical acclaim both regionally and nationally. The Collector is the first production of The New Theatre's 20th anniversary year. /Why are we asking for so much money?// /Well... here are just a few of our expenses:// //Theatre Rental: €1600 for The New Theatre's beautiful stage in Temple Bar  /Scenic, Lighting and Costume budgets: €1000+ to bring the world of this thrilling play to life / /Printing & copying: €500+ because a new play means new pages/ /Liability insurance: €300 just in case!/ /We are dedicated to paying every artist involved: actors, designer, photographer, stage manager, director, crew...// //And we believe in very affordable ticket prices – all tickets are €16 or less./More about the artists://Daniel Wade’s radio drama The Outer Darkness was broadcast on Dublin South FM in 2015. A published poet, his work has previously appeared in Optic, Limerick Revival, Wordlegs, The Stony Thursday Book (ed. Paddy Bushe), HeadSpace Magazine, the Seven Towers 2014 Census, the Bray Arts Journal, The Sea (charity anthology in aid of the RNLI), Sixteen Magazine, The Bogman’s Cannon, Iodine Poetry Journal, Zymbol, The Runt, Headstuff, The Fredricksburg Literary Review, The Lonely Crowd, A New Ulster, FLARE, Live Encounters Poetry. In April 2015 he was the Hennessy New Irish Writing poetry winner, published in The Irish Times. In October 2016 Daniel released Embers and Earth, an album of spoken-word poetry set to music. The Collector is his first stage play. /////Cian Ó Ceallacháin is a theatre director and playwright from Dún Laoghaire, and the founder of Underdog Theatre Productions. His past writing and directing credits include Waiting for Garda, Tonight Around Half-Eight (staged as part of the Ten Days in Dublin Festival) and A Storm in Swords which successfully ran in the Players Theatre and Áras Inis Gluaire. Other work includes Kenwarp Clinic, The Day the Coffee Ran Out and Murder at Hastings Abbey for Newpark Theatre Company, and he is currently an in-house writer for Tallaght-based theatre group, An Cosán (Closing Circle, Radio Jobstown, The Mindfulness Retreat). Most recently, he wrote and directed Aisling’s Seven, produced as part of Smock Alley’s Scene + Heard Festival, the Galway Fringe Festival, and for a two week run in Theatre Upstairs. Cian also co-wrote and directed Tingo (in collaboration with Jessie Doyle).////Graeme Coughlan is an actor and writer from Dublin. He graduated from the full time course at Momentum Acting Studio in December 2015 and has previously trained at Gaiety School of Acting. Recent theatre credits include Hamlet (Mill Productions), and Easter Tuesday (Bethencourt Productions). TV and film credits include Wrecking the Rising and Limoncello (short film).////Will Murphy is a graduate of B.A. Drama in Performance at DIT Conservatory of Music and Drama. Theatre includes: The Robert Emmet Experience (Arthur’s Bar), Chopin in Paris (Erin Arts Centre), The Arabian Nights (Project Arts), Attempts on our Lives (Devised Piece). He has starred in three previous Underdog productions, including A Storm in Swords (Beckett Theatre), Caitiff (The Mart), and Tingo (Boys School, Smock Alley). ///Michael Heavey has been a professional actor since 2005. While his primary focus has been theatre, he has also worked in film, most recently in The Old Secret (2016, dir. Fabiano Albuquerque) and the feature The Hit Producer (2014, dir. Kevin de la Isla O'Neill).///Kevin Brennan trained in Adam Acting Academy and Harlequin Acting Academy before being accepted into The Stanislavsky Studio in Focus Theatre where he trained under Deirdre O’Connell. In 2006, he joined Backstage Casting. Television credits include Damo and Ivor, Love/Hate, Fair City, The Clinic (RTÉ), and George Gently (BBC) as well as several advertisements for Galtee Rashers and Meteor. Theatre credits include Ribbons and Romance and December Sky (Blue Ribbon Theatre Company) and 25 to Clanwilliam, which was staged as part of the 1916 centenary celebrations. Currently working on his second novel, Kevin also writes and performs poetry for Dublin’s Underground Beat, who selected him as one of their team to perform at the Electric Picnic in 2014. /Joseph Duggan's film credits include Thank You Come Again (2016, dir. Stephen Clarke Dunne), Apples & Peaches (2016, dir. James Ryan), and The Intruder's Gambit (2016, dir. Stephen Horgan). His television work includes Secrets of Great British Castles (Channel 5 UK) and Vikings Seasons 4 & 5 (History)./Rewards: ////Dark Horse T-Shirt, yours for €30 or more///Thank You: /Thanks to The New Theatre, http://www.thenewtheatre.com for hosting the world premiere of The Collector. The Collector is being rehearsed at FRINGE LAB thanks to Tiger Dublin Fringe, http://fringefest.com and The Arts Council, http://www.artscouncil.ie. Thanks to The Hideout, http://thehideout.ie for generously providing a venue for cast photos. Kickstarter video background music: "Signs of Life" by Anamorphic Orchestra.//////
info.risks and challenges: We know how hard it is to produce new drama – because we've done it before. We are supremely confident in the merits of this production, and we have an incredible team – actors, creatives, and crew – many of whom Underdog Theatre Productions has worked with on our past 7 productions. We know that we have months of work ahead, but we are energized by the challenges, and excited to share this thrilling new play with you!/Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

data.blurb: How far would you go for revenge? The Collector is a dark thriller of regret, retribution and broken masculinity.

data.name: Red Planet (or One Way Ticket) Staged Reading

info.description: "Mars doesn't want us to be here. We are Aliens, a virus. We screwed up Earth already, and Mars took notice."For the last year, I've been compiling research and conducting interviews all around humanities upcoming mission to colonize Mars. I've been honored to interview five of the top one hundred Mars One hopefuls (twenty-four of which will be GOING to Mars), who all helped me answer the question:How could you give up everything to live on another planet?What I present to you is my story, a possible outcome, of this journey. The crew of my Project Jamestown are all fictional, but based off of real candidates. By supporting this project, you not only support a fantastic cast and crew, but also the developing Sci-Fi scene in theater.The Cast:Captain Susan Dare: Emily HamptonPrivate Adam White: Alexander OrandelloEngineer Ron Fessidan: Joseph RamondinoDr. Aziz Freely: Greg LakhanNavigator Cynthia Hariot: Anjelica Mitlitsky
info.risks and challenges: Your funding will help go towards paying our designers, acquiring costumes, and buying gifts for the people who were instrumental in getting us here./Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

data.blurb: Help support Red Planet, a new science fiction play based off the Mars One exploration.

data.name: Adventure Life (Official name still TBD)

info.description: We have one goal: TO BRING ADVENTURERS TOGETHER TO SHARE THEIR TRAVELS THROUGH OUR FREE APP. In this ever changing social media based world, everything is always "what celebrity is doing this, what Pokemon is where, who is dating who, what disaster is happing now", and it is all just a bit overwhelming and to be quite honest, depressing.Our idea is centered around creating a simple, user friendly app designed solely around sharing your adventures and encouraging people to get out and see the world. Whether you are a world traveler, sharing your adventures in South East Asia, or the casual hiker who wants to share your favorite local trail, this app will be for you.///Concept renderings///The name, and final functionality are a moving target, but what we can promise is a fun, interactive, relaxing and uplifting user experience. The definite functions are:/A social platform that allows you to share your adventures with other users on a macro or micro level. On a macro level, you can share pictures, either geo tagged or not. Brief descriptions if desired. Basically share as much or as little as you want. On a micro level, you can geo tag photos, share trail maps, tag hot spots, and more!/Users will be screened for authenticity, no bots, no spam, no fake users asking if you'd like to help their wealthy uncle wire his millions of dollars into your bank account. Security and privacy is a core goal./We WILL incorporate some sort of "Give Back" opportunity in our app that will give users the opportunity to donate to preservation efforts around the world. We will not shove it down your throat, but this is an important mission for us./Our Process if Funded:1. Functionality LayoutInvest a lot of time into going through all the details and find the right people who can translate Programmer to Civilian and vice versa.Go through every single screen and understand how all parts of the app interact with each other to ensure a great user experience.2. DesignOnce the functionality and user experience is PERFECT, we will focus on the design.We are working with best in class designers to come up with a great look, comfortable feel, and a fun experience.3. TEST, TEST, AND RE-TEST. 4. Going Live- Once funded, we hope to be live just 6 months later.We will start by submitting our app to the iTunes and Android stores – icons, descriptions, etc. Once live, we will market our app to build its user base.
info.risks and challenges: Risks and Challenges: /-Competition: We recognize that their is a great deal of social media competition in the market place and we need to differentiate ourselves. By create a unique user experience centered on a particular life style, we hope to capture users. We are not centered on taking users away from current platforms, we hope to be an addition to those platforms./-User Base: As our app will be user based, we need to make sure that our marketing plan is centered around the types of users we hope to capture, "the adventurer". We will team up with outdoor sporting good manufactures and encourage them to promote our app in exchange for non intrusive ad space in our ap./-Final Execution: We know we MUST deliver a user experience that is simple, friendly and fun. We hope to accomplish this through extensive testing, re-testing, followed by more testing./Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

data.blurb: An app centered solely around adventure, getting out and seeing the world, and sharing with friends. No drama, no spam, just fun.

data.name: Dog Trainer In Your Pocket

info.description: WHAT//A unique and accessible dog training app for owners with video tutorials and troubleshooting tips. Proven methods developed by one of the UK’s top training centres on your smartphone.//////WHY?/Imagine how wonderful it would be to have your own personal dog trainer at your disposal whenever and wherever you need it./Our goal is to give all dog owners expert advice at their fingertips so they can enhance the relationship with their dog using a proven programme based around education, play and health. We want to share our knowledge through our app Dog Trainer In Your Pocket.//////A well trained dog results in a happy dog. By giving more people a training tool that is always with them, we hope to improve an owner’s understanding of their dog and thus improve their dogs' behaviour in society./We believe that the ever-increasing number of uncontrollable dogs being abandoned or given up for rehoming, is partly due to a lack of understanding of the importance of education in a dog’s routine. Our app will be an attempt to address this issue by sharing our years of experience with dogs./WHO?/Conceived and driven by Mark and Gillian Thompson, owners of The Dog House, the UK's leading activity holiday and training facility for dogs. Created and brought to life by Leo Learning (previously Epic), a global provider of e-learning technologies. /This powerful combination of expertise will produce a unique and user friendly training tool.///////'Time spent at the Dog House has been an integral part of the development of a long-living and well-behaved dog. For over fifteen years our dogs have spent considerable amounts of time with Mark and his team, and every time they come home healthy, happy and full of energy – and looking a million dollars!' -Chris Sanderson/WHY KICKSTARTER?//We believe that through the Kickstarter platform we can reach and engage an audience beyond the existing loyal devotees of The Dog House. /For us, this is just the beginning of building a community around The Dog House, which will develop into something far greater than the app itself./THE APP///Will be simple and easy to navigate using//Large, rich, clear images///A high-end look-and-feel///Excellent use of video and animated graphics///Simple and clear tutorials covering a large range useful training tips and troubleshooting advice for common problems.///////This won't be a standard app. It requires a large amount of high-quality video production, photography and local resources, as well as complex back-end development. Self-publishing a project of this scope is a major undertaking.//As well as funding the cost of the build of the app itself, the money we raise will also be used for a marketing campaign, promoting the app to users around the world. Any surplus funds raised will be used towards creating videos for our own Youtube channel and the building of future bolt on modules for the app.////Our hope is to build a community of dog lovers who share our belief that educating your dog is the most important element of responsible dog ownership. We hope to create a platform on which owners can benefit from our experience, but also share their own ideas and tips to one another. /
info.risks and challenges: One of the biggest challenges we will face is not the build of the app (we have total faith in the expertise of Leo Learning to produce a great product) but the amount of content that we can include in this first edition. We see this initial app as the first of a series of training apps and are keen to have feedback from our users to guide us towards the subjects we cover next. /We also plan in time to have a website and You Tube channel where again we will be covering the subject matter that is too complex or lengthy to include in an app format./Regarding rewards, we are limited to the number of training courses we can fulfil at any one time, so will have to treat those on a first come first served basis. If that top level of reward is oversubscribed we will provide an interim solution of one to one training for owner and dog until we can confirm the date of a course./Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

data.blurb: A practical, easy to use dog training app, developed by experts with 20 years experience. Tips and video tutorials on the go.

data.name: What should we do? Social media app.

info.description: This app. would be the first realtime app that would allow people to log on and see how long the wait is at a particular restaurant or how long the line is at a club. What band is playing, cover charge, who's bartending, is there a lot of people there or is it dead. Also, list different events in a calander. Upcoming concerts sporting events etc. Businesses will pay to advertise, and there will be a free version and a premium version. So you will always know where the party is no matter what city you're   in. The idea is solid and currently there is nothing this focused on interactive social networking with an emphasis on realtime entertainment.  The $20,000 will go towards paying tech people at Mercer U. for the design process.
info.risks and challenges: The only challenge is funding the tech people. I have over 30 years experience in the restaurant and nightclub business. I know the ins and outs of the industry as well as a reputation to help with with marketing and advertising sales locally for the initial test market. My wife has degrees in journalism and a degree in public speaking from Georgia State and i attended business school at university of Maryland. She also has over a decade as a news anchor,producer, and managing editor.  So combined we have all the skills and resources necessary except for the technology./Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

data.blurb: app that let's individuals see what's up in whatever city that they are in. Divided into categories bars, restaurants user interact liv

data.name: Quit Smoking iOS App and Research Project

info.description: The Quit Smoking ProjectAs a  pharmacy student at the Thomas J. Long School of Pharmacy and Health Sciences at the University of Pacific, I get exposed to a lot of patients at our free health fair outreach events and in the pharmacy. This allows me to witness the tolls that smoking can take on the body and on a patient's overall health. I started the Quit Smoking Project in order to explore new ways of using technology to help lead to positive patient outcomes. My long term goal is to take what I learn from making an iOS app for smoking cessation and apply that knowledge to other disease states in the future, such as diabetes and cardiovascular diseases. What sets this application apart from every other application is that it was developed with the driving force of research in mind. The application is developed from the ground up to be used as a research tool. It is true that there are other smoking cessations apps on the iOS App Store, but they were not designed to help push forward the collective knowledge on health care. We live in a world surrounded by technology, such as smartphones, and many different research groups are focusing on why this may be having a negative effect on our health, but the end goal should be finding ways of making this technology have positive effects on our health. The goal of this project is not just providing smoking cessation for the patient, but it is also to create momentum that will drive scientists and health care providers to create even more innovative patient oriented applications that have a positive effect on the patient's well being. If I am able to show positive results with my research, then I can provide a model for future projects to push innovation even further with personalized technology driven health care. /////How is it different?The largest differentiating factor of this application for the patient is that this app is based off a well established algorithms, such as the RxForChange algorithm, in order to aid the patient in the first, and often most difficult step of quitting, which is deciding the correct path they should take. Most applications currently assume the patient is able to decide the correct nicotine replacement therapy on their own after deciphering all of the information about each product, their side effects, and contraindications. I believe that these are false assumptions in most cases. This application will actively guide the patient through 5-8 questions and then based on their answers, it will present a product that best fits their lifestyle and current health conditions in order to give the patient the best opportunity to quit. It will also give the patient quick access to the product information, such as detailed directions, side effects, and contraindications. The application also allows the patient to set a quit date in order to remind them that they set a goal to quit. With informed consent, all of this data will be de-identified, as described under HIPAA regulations, and then collected for research purposes.The ResearchSpecifically, in this research project, the goal will be to:/Track the success of the application in guiding the patient to the correct nicotine replacement therapy/Determine if the patient sticks to their quit date after using the app/Assess if the app is effective in aiding the patient in quitting smoking by checking back in after a set amount of time, such as two weeks. /I am also collecting data for many other endpoints to help assess the efficacy of the mobile application. The IRB proposal will be submitted to the Board at the University of Pacific in Stockton.What about privacy?I have also derived a way to do this meaningfully with de-identified data to protect the privacy of the patient. This means that no information is every transmitted that can tie you to any of the research data. This will be verified by the University of Pacific IRB upon submission of my research proposal. What if I don't want to be in the research project but still want to use the app?If you do not provide informed consent, then you still have full access to the app and all its benefits without any of your information being collected for the research project.What will the money be used for?The money will be used for all projected costs that will be associated with the successful launch of the product. These include, but are not limited to:/Developer Registration Fees/New Mac OS X computer (current one is on its last legs)/Private and Secure Server Costs (de-identified data will need to collected for at least 1 year)/and other smaller costs
info.risks and challenges: There are risks and challenges associated with every Kickstarter project, but I will do everything I can in order to help minimize these./One of the challenges is coding this application while attending Pharmacy school, however, I have been able to manage my time appropriately and should be able to complete the project during my summer break. /Another large challenge is coding the app on my current aging laptop, this challenge will be eliminated with a successful Kickstarter./A potential risk is the denial of the IRB approval by the University of Pacific. I have sought to minimize this risk by seeking guidance from several faculty members in creating the best possible proposal. If the research proposal is still release the application to the public, but remove all of the research aspects of the project, so that users will still have the benefit of using the app to help them quit smoking./Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

data.blurb: Quitting smoking is one of the most difficult tasks to undertake, our main goal is to research, guide and educate to ensure success.

data.name: Divvy - Divide and Conquer your shopping

info.description: Divide and Conquer your grocery shopping//////////////////////////////////// We believe that shopping for the whole house should be simple, not stressful. That’s why we're creating Divvy./Give and we'll give back, check out the Kickstarter exclusive rewards!  //Here's some more info on what could be in your divvy box! /////We hope you’ll support our small, committed, and youthful-­but­-experienced team bring Divvy into the pockets of every household! ////////////////////////////////
info.risks and challenges: Making an app isn’t straightforward. We’ve planned Divvy from the ground up to avoid as many issues as possible, but we can’t always ensure smooth sailing. Anyone with a software background knows that bugs and delays are inevitable, and as such we’ve budgeted some extra time for such occurrences./Kickstarter backers have the unique opportunity to be an integral part of this development process. By gaining early access to a Divvy Beta test, we hope you can help us iron out any issues before launch./A large unknown for us, however, is how big Divvy will end up. As a company we will have to grow with our product. As our user base expands, we may find the need to take on additional staff, and spend on our backend architecture and server space to keep up. This is a cost that we can only guess at, but we’ve run the numbers and we’re confident we can keep up with your demands./Finally, we cannot guarantee that Apple will accept Divvy onto the App Store first time around. This is always an unknown for app developers, but we've taken steps to mitigate our chances of failure, and we hope we can get Divvy into your pocket and your housemates pockets as soon as possible./Backing our young team is a vote of confidence in our future and in what Divvy can become, and we know we can deliver. It is our hope that, with your support, Divvy can be released on time or even ahead of schedule, and we’ll be doing everything in our power to make that happen./Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

data.blurb: Divvy is a shared shopping list for the whole house. With Divvy, you can rest assured that you buy exactly what you need.

data.name: The Poly Life on Android

info.description: The Poly Life is the first app designed specifically with people in polyamorous relationships in mind. The app features calendar events, poly chat, to do lists, agreements, maps as well as ways to keep your poly family/lovers organized by family category and relationship status. It's the best app to use for managing all of your relationships! /////The app was launched in 2014 on iOS and since then, the demand for an Android version has been non-stop. This demand is very exciting for us but also challenging because this app is a niche product. We have not and do not expect to recoup the money that has been spent creating this app. We didn't create this app to make money, we created it for our community. We wanted to provide a way for people in multiple relationships to live their life instead of spending countless hours trying to maintain it with multiple apps. The Poly Life is a single app that can maintain relationships with ease. We are now asking for YOUR HELP to raise 50% of what we will need in order to create the Android companion to the iOS app. You've asked for it and we want to deliver! But we can't do it without you. So please help us spread the word and share this with everyone you know. We must reach at least $5,000 in order to build and launch the app on Google Play. This is an expensive app and together we've raised half the funds to build it but we need your help to raise the other half. This is our last chance to get the Android app released.  By selecting one of our rewards on Kickstarter, not only are you helping us fund the app but you are pre-ordering The Poly Life and securing a download code once it's released. Please note: if the app gets funded, we will be sending our backers Google Play promo codes to download the app. Google Play allows 500 promo codes per quarter so please make note of our rewards. FIRST QUARTER means you will receive the app as soon as it is completed and live on the Google Play store (by Spring 2017). SECOND QUARTER means you will receive the app as soon as the promo codes reload for us (by Summer 2017). THIRD QUARTER means you receive the app as soon as the promo codes reload for us a third time (by late Summer to early Fall 2017). Of course, we wish we could make all of the promo codes immediately available but that's unfortunately just the way Google Play is currently set up. Keep in mind just a few short months ago, Google Play didn't even offer promo codes so the fact that they do now is a huge plus and is making this Android launch using Kickstarter's help a real possibility for us now! To learn more about The Poly Life, please visit the following:http://thepolylife.comhttps://www.facebook.com/thepolylifeapp/https://twitter.com/ThePolyLife
info.risks and challenges: The Poly Life on Android is an extremely low risk project. We have already successfully created the iOS version so we are taking everything we've learned and applying that to the Android version with a very talented development team. /The only true risk associated with funding this app is that although we will try our absolute hardest to get the app finished by or before Spring 2017, there may be unforeseen challenges during programming that cause the timeline to shift a little. That said, no matter how many challenges we encounter, the Android version of this app will launch as long as we hit our goal of $5,000. That is our promise to you./Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

data.blurb: The Poly Life is the first app designed to help poly people manage their relationships with ease. Help us launch this app on Android!

data.name: Social Freedom

info.description: People love to spend time on social media sites, however too much time on these sites can cause people to miss what is going on around them and even become addicting. The need to update a status, check messages, or check in, can limit the time you are spending with the people close to you and possibly reduce productivity at work. The app "Social Addiction" is an app special directed to those who want to limit or quit the amount of time they spend on social media sites. The Social Addiction app works by charging the user a fee each time they login or spend a set amount of time on a site. The fee that can be anywhere between $0 - $100 is transferred automaticly to either the users savings account or to a non-profit organization of their choosing. A ratio can even be set up to determine how much of the fee goes into their savings account and how much goes to charity. The development plan for the Social Addiction app requires time and programming of secure pathways between banks and non profit organizations. As well and getting the Social Addiction App the exposure it needs to find the people it can help the most. I plan on starting by introducing the app to the Apple App store for iPhone and iPad first and then branching out to other devices from there.I strongly believe that with your support that is project can be a huge success, as well as help thousands of people at the same time.
info.risks and challenges: The only real risks that I foresee with this project is, development of the the app taking too long, and or the app not getting the exposure to the public it needs.  /However I fully belie that with hard work,  setting milestone goals point, and building a simple yet quality App this project will be an amazing success story./Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

data.blurb: An App to help people quit or limit their time spent on social media.

data.name: Slappr

info.description: About SLAPPRSLAPPR is is the idea of shouting out anything into the world. Since the world is already connected through internet, we wanted to create an app which uses that connection for something good & positive. We came out to this social experiment we called SLAPPR, when we saw someone slap another in order to get their attention.When you've completed your message in SLAPPR, just press send and SLAPPR sends your message to a random SLAPPR user in the world. For now, we've chosen to keep the app's language english.Sending slapps equals receiving slapps. When you receive a slapp you'll get notified on your smartphone by sound and notification bar. When you open your slapp, you'll only see the slapp's content with two options; a happy face and sad face. /(you'll earn the privilege of seeing where the message came from later)If the message triggered anything positive, you press the 'smile button'/If you didn't like the content of the message, press the sad button. If you don't 'judge' your received slaps, you won't be able to send any. When opening the app, you'll have to judge your received messages first.We want to keep the app balanced & minimal with usability and performance as high as possible./When you start the SLAPPR app, it'll open the 'send' screen by default. Here you can type in anything, and send./If you slide to the left or right, you can access other menu's.Here's a demo of a first encounter with SLAPPR:///////You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.//////Play////////////////////////////Replay with sound//////////Play with  sound/////////////00:00///00:00////////////////////////////////Other menu's1. Your statsHere you see your karma level and earned privileges. /The karma concept was added to create a form of gamification and motivation to send 'good' messages. Obviously 'good' is subjective as someone elsewhere might not like the message you would like, but the karma concept limits the trolls/spammers among us.The Karma concept works a following:/- At start, you'll be able to send and receive one slapp a day, to one person./  also the length of your message is limited to 144 characters/- If someone liked your message you'll see your karma-level grow/- If you reach various karma-levels, you'll earn or loose the following privileges:/	- sending/receiving more than one message a day/	- sending longer messages (144+)/	- adding a photo/	- sending audio/	- re-slapp received messages/Note: you'll never be able to directly send back a message to someone, receivers will never see the author of a message.2. Your 'Slappmap'/This is a map of the world, showing lines from your hometown or region to other places in the world, these lines represent the trails of your messages.There's no inbox; SLAPPR is only a messaging service, no storage. To compensate this we'll add a 'social media share' button, so you can share/save your message directly.An important concept is re-slapping, this means someone likes the slapp so much he/she is willing to risk his own karma for it and slapps it forward to other users, the amount depending on his/her karma of course. This is risky for the re-slapper, so the re-slapper will be also be rewarded for likes.3. SettingsThis is a regular settings menu, here you can:/Set app theme; male, female or transgender /Limit the amount of slaps you want to receive per day (this amount equals the amount of slapps you can send.) /Sound control/Notification control///////////The back-end is powered by a basic, but high-performance web-server with a highly scalable NoSQL database as the primary datastore. On the front-end we have the basics of the Android client. But there's still a lot of work to be done. We did this in one week. The visual designs are OK, but we're not expert designers nor do we currently have the budget to get help on it. So with your help we could really make the app shine!/////GOALSAdditional extensions: /iOS version/Social media share features/If we achieve our goal of €5.000 we will:/Finish the app with all the additional features + features suggested by our backers./Continue on developing the app & publishing data generated by it's users/Make the app available for iOS devices/Get help to finish the graphic design/Get help to brand the app/Follow us on facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Slappr/918164928198734
info.risks and challenges: A social experiment/SLAPPR is a social experiment. The purpose of SLAPPR should be open for interpretation. It would be disappointing to discover that people use SLAPPR for commercial or hateful purposes. Obviously, there are ways of limiting people from doing this, but we will only implement such changes if proven necessary./Changes & development/We are very curious what people do with SLAPPR, therefore, we will share certain data with our backers and/or the world. Based on these results & feedback we could continue developing the app. Developing this app takes a lot of time, since we are a small business./User generated content /Our goal is to make SLAPPR available to everyone on as many devices as possible. But like every app, it needs to be promoted. Without users, we won't have input to continue developing. That's one of the reasons we're raising money. Without budget we're limited to writing websites and blogs about SLAPPR. We fairly hope that our backers will also contribute by spreading the name and the idea online & offline./Android & iOS/We've programmed this app with great love and care. For the people that don't know; programming for Android is done in another language then for example iOS. Especially when you want to achieve maximum performance. Programming takes time, therefore we've started this project for the Android users. (since Android is market leader) If we reach our goal, we'll buy a developers license from Apple and start building the app for iOS. This could be done within two weeks./Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

data.blurb: Send & receive personal messages to & from somewhere on the planet. Anonymous. Inspire people, build up karma, earn more privileges

data.name: Custom Transitions

info.description: What is Custom Transitions? Are you someone that has all these fabulous images in your phone and you want to have more than one background but there is just too much and you can't keep changing it or you forget or you get tired of changing it? Our Custom Transitions is an application for android that will give people the ability to customize their background by giving them the option to automatically cycle through a set of images that the user picks for their backgrounds. Allowing you to see new images all the time and enjoy all of your images instead of having them sit inside your album under dozens if not hundreds of other images and are rarely being seen.How it works The user will be able to select from different option settings to have their images cycle from. Some of these options will be by time, when the phone shakes, when the phone locks, the temperature of your local area, holidays, seasons, dates, and when you receive/send a phone call or text./When the user selects one of the options above, they will be asked to select an existing album or to create a new one. If you create a new album you will select all the images you want to cycle as your background. Your Options Time-This option will allow you to pick a time of day or duration in which the background will change. Phone Locks-Every time your phone locks, your background will change. Receive or Send a text/call-You can set up so the background will change when you receive and/or send a text/call or any combination of those such as having it cycle when you receive a call but not a text and have it change when you send a text but not when you make a call. Outside Temperature-The Background will change depending on the temperature outside. You can create multiple albums for various temperature such as a hot album, warm album, perfect day album, cold album, freezing album, etc. Dates-Using this option, the user will be able to select any date they wish or even a range of dates and then name it and select their album. Holidays-The user will be able to select any holiday and have their album play through that holiday. Seasons-You can set up albums for every seasons. When the seasons change, so does your album, so does your background, automatically. Sub-Options Sub-options is the next step in customizing your transitions. After you pick an option, you will then be able to select a sub-option. Certain sub-options will only work with certain options. They are the same as the options that you see above but the sub-options will affect the option itself. For example, if you select Outside Temperature as your option you will then be able to choose the Time sub-option. So when your Hot album is selected you can have it transition how many times you want. Or you can select phone shake or phone locks, etc. Prioritizing You will be able to have more than one option active at once, but this could cause contradiction with your background. If you have the season option active and also a holiday, which one will play? So we will add a prioritizing system so you can rearrange on what you want to take priority.  For example you can have the season option on (Priority 3), with the holiday option (Priority 2), and the date option (Priority 1). The season option will play regularly, but then Christmas comes so your phone will start showing your Christmas album, but then you had a date set during the Christmas holiday, so during that day your phone will show the date option instead. When that day is over it will go back to the holiday option, when the holiday is over it will go back to the season option. What makes your app different from others? We allow a larger customization option for the users to ultimately customize the transition of your background. We will also be looking for new ways to help you customize your phone even further. We look forward to hearing from the community to hear what they have to say and their ideas that they would like to see implemented into the application.
info.risks and challenges: Every project will have its bumps in the road, but with the skill of the team i picked to work on this project and with your help, we will be able to fix it with no problem./We will address any problem and fix it. We will listen to the community and depend on their feedback to help us out as well./This app is currently being developed for android. If you enjoy it, we will develop it for as many platforms as possible./Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

data.blurb: Custom Transitions is a new application for your smartphone that helps you customize the way you see your background every day.

data.name: Extremely Easy Exercises

data.name: HitMe ϟ The Perfect Challenge App– Because Sky is The Limit!

info.description: /////HITME is the go-to app if you want to accomplish things & push yourself beyond your limits. With the app, you are able to :/Send challenges to friends, family & others in the world./Receive challenges from us every day./Receive challenges from people around the world & accomplish things like never before./Share the challenges you’ve done with just one friend, all of them, or even the world./View & like people’s accomplishments/Get points for the challenges you complete, as well as the likes you get from them./Compete with everyone, and have fun!////// //////  The world is filled with challenges everywhere; challenges that are just waiting to be completed. Sending someone on Mars & going on the fastest rollercoaster are some examples of challenges we could face right now. However, the difference between these two is simply that one has much more support than the other. It can be hard to accomplish something if we don’t have people that pushes us to do it. That’s why we’re creating HITME. Why not push ourselves beyond our limits more often? Let’s move & accomplish things while having fun! Big challenges shouldn’t be the only ones that we notice. With HITME, every challenge has people behind, supporting you. Let your friends challenge you, and you won’t be the only one to know what you accomplished anymore. Share it with the world and be proud of yourself! Remember, Sky is the limit. ///// ///// Everyone can do great things. Let’s help them by creating an app that pushes everyone beyond their limits while having fun. We want the people to be proud of themselves & to show the world their accomplishments. We can create a better place by bringing the community together & make every action count./////We are an experienced, dedicated, and confident team, ready to give our 200% on this project. Support HITME, and help us live our dreams & build something that could bring joy to the community. In fact, if you help us, not only you’ll bring a smile to our faces, but also in yours. We have great things prepared for our backers!///// /////The 36 000$ isn’t just an amount that we threw on Kickstarter. We thought about how we could make sure the app works. Here’s a representation of how we will distribute the amount:////// Kickstarter cost: First, a successful Kickstarter campaign has fees. Those fees are around 10% in total, which is $3 600. After that, there is the cost of the rewards. Since we have graphics designers skills, the cost is mostly time. However, there are some rewards that requires money for material (like shirts). Depending on the amount of backers we got, the amount needed will vary. However, we could estimate around $2 000, which makes a total of $5 600./// Development: To develop a fully functional app, fix the bugs & establish ourselves in the App Store, we need 6 to 9 months. We will need $28 800 to cover the 9 months cycle./// Marketing: When you’ve just finished a great new product, you get that awesome feeling. However, that feeling doesn’t stay for long if nobody knows about your product & as a result, people don’t use it. We are Marketing students at the University of Ottawa, so the HITME team will most likely be able to manage it. Nonetheless, since Marketing isn’t free, we’ll need to invest some money into that. The rest of the money will help cover the marketing cost and get HITME out there.//////
info.risks and challenges: Alright, let’s take a look at HITME and talk about its challenges. The first challenge would be obviously to extend our development team to complete the app. The second challenge would be to provide an app that meets users' expectations, and get widely adopted./The HITME team is pretty confident on resolving these challenges with our organization, our motivation & our experience. We believe we can make a great application that everyone will be able to enjoy./Just HITME, & you'll see.../that Sky Is The Limit!/Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
