data.name: Mit

info.description: I am sure that most of you have heard at least one person complaining about the fact that nowadays socializations happens only online. And, sadly, that or those persons are right and their reasons to complain are getting stronger as each day passes.I believe we reached a high peak in technology development, which is not necessarily a bad thing, because technology enriches our life style, but also makes us loose on the way a very important aspect of life: HUMANITY.//////And this is where mit comes in!/I do not want to say that this app will solve the humanity's problems, nor that will change the values we are already guided by, but I hope it will help the communities to encourage people to keep the values they already have and embrace./The idea behind the app is very simple: you sign in for an account by using your phone number, without leaving any extra data because we are not interested in your social and demographic data and turning people into targets, you confirm your number and you can start inviting the friends you have in your phone's agenda for a beer, juice, movie, so on. /////You can see in real time who confirms, you can chat with the friends that confirmed that will attend your event and you can upload photos from your event, photos that will be saved in an album in the app.//////Furthermore, you can see who is using mit from your agenda and you can suggest others to use the app.//////Mit's first version will be a very simple one, but if we find some financial solutions, we will improve this version with more complex options to achieve our main goal: to encourage the face to face meetings.
info.risks and challenges: Mit's main challenge is to remind people that they are explorers, they were made to go out and find what the world is all about.  And, even though it sounds very easy, in fact, it's a dirty work because people got really lost in all the Social Media's virtual realities. /That is why we built a team made of a genuine explorer that got out ok from the Mongol Rally, a crazy marketing expert that hitchhiked from Anger, France to Bruxelles, Belgium, an open minded copywriter and an art that is a bit negativist, but that helps us to see the problems from a 360 degree perspective. /Together we are ready to anticipate why people won't go out and send them the proper messages that would make them take their life at the next level and enjoy the real experience in life./Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

data.blurb: Mit is breaking the online socialization myth

data.name: Learn how to create iPhone apps & games from start to finish

info.description: There is still room for another dream come true!Opportunities are rampant, if you know what you're doing. Check out Flappy Bird and its clones in the Apple® App Store. Those applications are pretty successful. If you should choose not to go it alone, then just look at the job boards. Nearly three-quarters of the postings are mobile-related and one-third of them are seeking iOS developers. Plus, if you have something in the App Store with a 4-Star rating, your inbox will be heavily bombed by recruiters from nearly everywhere.Why am I making this course?When I first started learning iOS programming. I have no ideas where to start and what books to read./There are so many online courses on the internet. which one is providing the most accurate and reliable information?/After having few years real world iOS programming experiences. I went back to those books I read, courses I have taken. I have realized that I have been wasting 3 quarters of my time in learning some of those stuffs. /lots of those tutorials were either taking the wrong approach or using the very bad programming practices. /furthermore, most of those tutorial are fragmented and lack of serialization. /that's why this course come into play./I am trying to make this course just about to cover the enough key information in order for you to become a decent iOS developer./I am getting there. but, I do need your support though./Please help me finish this project!I am also thinking to make an iPhone & iPad app for this tutorial. So, you can learn from anywhere you go. the app is available to all backers. It will be free to download from app store, but login is required. You will get the login information once the KS campaign is successfully funded. /however,  I am not sure if apple allow me doing it. I would give it shot anyway. wish me lock!Android and other mobile phone users can access to this tutorial through mobile web.How this course differs from the rest?The greatest single advantage of this course is it's practical and pragmatic. For starters, you will learn from a highly experienced iOS developer with more than 50 apps published in the App Store under his belt . . . and you can learn from his experiences, good and bad. Next, this course will help cut you a clear path to the destination of your iOS app adventure. both video and text lessons from a variety of different angles giving you a better picture mastering iOS programming. The course provides 5 tutorial series governed only by your willingness to invest in yourself.Course ComponentsThe course has five components, each one locked to your level of investment.Level 1 Tutorial: Even at entry-level, this tutorial provides intensive information about the iOS app industry, including why you should build an iOS app or become a developer; profitable ways to build your app; the essential tools and programming languages you need to master; plus (and this is vitally important at every stage) how to become an iOS developer and submit your iPhone and iPad apps to the Apple App Store . . . and much more. Once you've completed this tutorial, you will have everything you need to be able to choose the correct tools and pick the smoothest path to your career as an iOS app developer.Level 2 Tutorial: This module focuses on iOS programming. The iOS library is huge, with around 7,000 APIs and still growing. Now, imagine trying to memorize each one of those 7,000 APIs. It's impossible. However, completing this course will give you an arsenal of tips and tricks on how to use any API the moment you see it.You will also learn various techniques on how to approach the hard programming problems so solving them becomes a snap. And when those problems do arise, you'll learn the best way to find the bugs and crush them. When you complete the course, you will be able to code a moderately complicated iOS application on your own.Level 3 Tutorial: This module is about generating ideas. We all have ideas, but how many of them are worthwhile? How many will turn users on, then trigger the download? The course will help you determine the viability of your iOS app by teaching you how to measure your ideas for feasibility, user appeal and profitability so you can make sure that developing them is worth your time and effort  . . . before you begin. You'll also learn some common design patterns so you can avoid your iOS app getting the dreaded 1-Star rating.Level 4 Tutorial: This module is all about visibility. You can create the greatest, slickest iOS app in the universe, but if no one can find it, if it doesn't show up early in the app store, you're doomed. All your hard work and investment is for nothing. This course can help you fix that. Those inside secrets professional developers use to improve their listings? The same ones they don't disclose on the Internet? They're yours now. because this information is that valuable, it is only available for backers at this level.In addition to that, I will throw a couple of hybrid app templates with detailed instruction of usage, It should get you up and running within 20 minutes. This module can plug into pretty much anything you could imagine. such as social networking, book, photo, video and even game applications and so on.Full version app examples: You get the actual source codes for real working iOS apps. This is an excellent way to learn by example, which is the best way to learn. Hands-on always trumps theory. This module gives you the opportunity to familiarize yourself with how the experts did, then you can duplicate in an exercise that's guaranteed to build your confidence so you can get to work on your own apps the moment you finish the course.Where do you take the course?The course is available online, 24/7/365. So you can learn at your own pace.When will the tutorials be delivered?The instant I surpass my funding goal, I will start uploading and updating the content on a daily basis.Who is Willie Shi?I, Willie Shi, have over 18 years experience in programming, including 6 years creating and developing iOS apps. I have published over 50 apps in the Apple App Store, you can find most of them from my website. worked for such top-tier companies such as Yahoo and graduated from UC Berkeley and Wuhan University.Why this course and why now?Simply stated, I wanted people to learn from my mistakes and use my successes to make their journey faster and easier. When I first started learning iOS, I had no idea where to start, what books to read or which courses to take. I could not find a single resource that tied everything together. Eventually, I found books and enrolled on courses from Stanford and Harvard. But there were still times when I got frustrated, especially when I began coding over 5,000 APIs from the iOS library, I struggled for a time until I figured out a way that I could blend all these disparate resources together painlessly. Once I did that, there was no more head-scratching and no more need to Google everything I coded. Objective C is now one of my strongest programming languages and I added it to my resume with pride.Today, I want to pass on my personal learning experiences and the shortcuts I found to others who are also eager to become an iOS developer quickly, easily and painlessly.What if the final funding exceeds your goal?You get the benefit. More backers means more content and bonus courses can be added based on the final funding amount.What if I want to support this project but don't wish to become an iOS developer?No problem. All support is welcomed. Just copy and paste the link below to your Facebook page and Twitter account. Then make sure you let me know you are helping to promote the project and I will friend you on LinkedIn, Facebook and Twitter . . . and tell the world about your entrepreneurial spirit.http://kck.st/1jprYBe.FAQ:Do you have a sample tutorials we can look?YES, due to the space issue, I have posted few Text Tutorials on my website, More are coming up soon. You can check them out from the link bellow.http://www.8land.org/iOS_programming/ks_iOS_tutorialCan we see some of your apps?of course, here are some of youtube videos I created early.http://youtu.be/C-Univ8PcI0https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EO8iAgRsA4Ehttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5wpq9AcwdOU&noredirect=1Questions/Comments?Drop me a note. I will respond to every single request.
info.risks and challenges: The risk is very low. I am a proven commodity with over 50 apps already in the Apple App Store, 10 more unpublished apps on my hard drive ready to go and all the knowledge and experience needed to help you develop your iOS apps is there at my fingertips. /meanwhile, I have been working on creating text tutorial for about a month and half now. I am trying to make it the best possible I can, if in case something you think it’s important should be covered in this tutorial, please, don’t hesitate and let me know./extra bonus might need extra time. please bear with me. I would do my best to deliver what I have planed on time. if something unexpected is happening. I would make sure it won’t off schedule too much./Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

data.blurb:
iOS programming tutorials for creating iPhone and iPad apps.
Text/Video courses help to boost your learning in iOS apps/games easily.

data.name: Pixstavault™ - the LAST photo app you will EVER need!

info.description: ///// /In our day to day lives amazing things happen, incredible sights, phenomenal food, experiencing these all with our favorite people. Our moments create who we are and we want to create the ability to refresh our memories with these moments. Look back and recreate those feelings. We want the ability to commemorate our lives journaling these moments. We want this without limitations. For most of us our parents did just this. Every moment, every step, every accomplishment. For some of this, other moments happen that change the course of your life and you wish you had had these memories persevered./When I was a small girl, right in the midst of amazing feats and the promise of my future, I lost my mother to cancer when I was 4. My ONLY memories of those times are preserved with photographs. The moments we do have captured mean the world to me and bring back to life a smile and feeling that left all those years ago, but brings me right back into that moment. /After her passing day to day photographs become few and far between, they turned into vacation and events only photographs. After I lost my dad suddenly when I was 30, the ability to know more about my mother's life, his life and my own life were gone. /I want to preserve EVERY moment of my life, without limitation. Every smile and every tear, every proud moment and those that make you wonder, their goofy times, their serious times, the moments that make us a family and that make them their own people./PixstaVault™ was born out of necessity when one of these moments arose in my eldest daughter’s life. She had signed on with L’Oreal as one of their models. After all day prep, backstage memories and moments, it was time to prep for the stage. I asked for her phone as it was newer and I had assumed it had been plugged in all day and that she would had the forethought to empty her memory./As she placed her phone in my hand, she did have the battery required, but her memory was critically low. I then pulled out my phone which had sufficient room but with 15 mins of battery remaining. Her stylist was then asked if she could replace a model in the show, so she asked if I too could take photos for her! She said that her phone had incredible space on it, but her battery was also low. The odds were stacked against us. When you are under pressure it is hard to focus on quality. I honestly took as many as I could in the batteries duration for both phones, I was displeased with the outcome./I then began to ask people what was something that would change their lives, and from the answers I received – an app that could do it all and never tell ME what I could and could not do with my $1000 phone./So what is Pixstavault™ and what can it do? //////It is truly the FIRST EVER to incorporate all your photo taking, editing, sharing, storage and social media needs - ALL-IN-ONE! You TAKE your photos.You EDIT your photos, and if you are like me, this is a long tedious process going in and out of multiple apps, finding different filters, artwork, quotes, borders etc - NOT ANY MORE! We have doubled the basic minimum and are giving you ALL the options, with the option for SO much more!/////You want to SHARE your photos. Before it was straight to social media, fumbling with clouds in the sky, or tediously making group chats or groups on text to send multiple photos, with limitations./////Pixstavault™ offers you LIMITLESS sharing! Imagine being on assignment for work and you are taking photos and your boss needs them to be perfect? Imagine him receiving a copy every time you take one? Sending you automatic feed back? REAL TIME sharing without limitations? Imagine photographers, weddings, babies being born ... never missing something if you can't be there?You want to STORE your photos. As mentioned, fumbling through the clouds in the sky can be tedious, expensive. With our NEW web app software, when you download our app you make choices as to what to do when your phone gets low! Send them to your existing cloud, send them to our service, OR the best - send them home? Yes I said it - HOME! Whichever setting you choose it stays, and when the DEVICE LOW screen appears, you tap the logo and you miss nothing but 1 second. /////The last feature - OUR APP HAS FULL CUSTOMIZATION!/Yes, I did say that! YOU choose the colours, the format, YOU make the choices./You can choose how YOU see your photos/videos, how others see your photos/videos. /You can choose to have a "timeline"./You can choose to have a FEED./You can choose to turn options on or off./You can write things and make the decisions on who, what, how and when.////// Social Media currently controls how you view your world. Would you like that to change? Would you like to control the colours, the feel of the feed, if people can comment, like or share?Do you want your social media to be more social?Pixstavault™ has features that no other APP or media outlet has - we are solving the problem by giving you the rights to the solution. You get a say in what you post, how you post it, how others perceive it AND react to it!/////We will also be introducing a WEB APP + Business Branding!Its 2016! WE are giving YOU your life, memories, moments and world do with as YOU choose!  Having 100% control of your devices, memories + moments – and allowing the world or just your people to be a part of your journey, as it happens. /We saw a problem and we created a solution, in 2016, 2.5 trillion photos were shared or stored online, a 15 percent increase from the prior year. Three-quarters of this total were shared, and the remainder backed up online. It is estimated the number of photos shared online to be about 31 times the volume taken (let alone shared) in the 1990s, when about 80 billion were taken every year./80 billion photos – with most apps creating 2-8 copies, filling phones, people afraid of intrusive apps recording your location in order to help. So many different apps all in one, saving time, saving money and SAVING memories! So, there you have it! We need YOUR support to help us move onto the next stage! Over the past two years we have grass rooted, created, designed, developed and tested – now we need you to be of this amazing journey./Be apart of something revolutionary, be apart of change! ///Pixstavault™ - the LAST photo app you will EVER need! //////
info.risks and challenges: We are asking for $100,000 to go towards further development, creation of our servers for our social media component and to offer 24/7 support./While we have gone to every effort to predict the best way for the APP to function across all platforms and how it will pertain to any problems that might arise.  /We are confident moving forward that once we have created the support team/staff we will be able to navigate and troubleshoot any problems.  We are all working towards creating the greatest APP and we want to allow for an incredible experience./Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

data.blurb: Truly the FIRST EVER app to incorporate all your photo/video taking, editing, sharing, storage and social media - ALL-IN-ONE!

data.name: Brayne

info.description: The aim of this project is to create a game that is simple, fun, and engaging. I am very much aware that the market is saturated with all types of gaming applications, but rarely have I experienced a game that challenges the current level of UI quality. To put it simply, there is definitely room for a game that is simple, functional and aesthetically pleasing. Paying close attention to each of these elements, offers Brayne the best possible chance of appealing to various demographics.
info.risks and challenges: Possible extension by a week or two at the maximum - anticipated back-end complexities and future software updates./User testing may surface additional key requirements, in which case an additional 2 weeks will be added for both design and development adjustment./All of these risks/challenges were factored in when the project plan was created./Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

data.blurb: Brayne, a simple but engaging game that requires users to simply view and replicate a sequence in order to achieve their highest score.

data.name: 'Eline speaks'

info.description: About Eline?Eline is a care worker for the disabled people at ‘Ons Tweede Thuis’ (Our Second Home). In her work, existing assistive technology solutions have been an annoyance for years. They’re rigid and expensive, and they poorly fit the evolving needs of users and social workers.Eline started working with a new residential group and wanted to set up her name and photo on the speech computers that were already being used. Making the adjustments took up so much time and energy that she thought, 'there has to be a better way!'Her brother Mark worked at a company specialized in digital communications & user experience. Together, they conceived of ‘Eline Speaks’ and developed it. The speech app that turns an iPad into a full fledged speech computer. A revolutionary development in the world of assistive technology solutions!Innovation in mHealth'Eline Speaks' is originated in the workplace and developed 'bottom-up'. By combining existing hardware ( iPad ) with a clever & intuitive app we created a new product that contributes to more joy in life and better care. We focussed first on the wishes and demands of clients, parents & care workers instead of specialists, institutions and insurance companies. As a result, we have been able to get the product keeping up to the (changing) needs of users and at the same time keep it simple and intuitive to use.The next faseThe funding is for the next fase. Improve the UX of the app, make it multilingual & help people with disabilities communicate with ease for more joy in life and better care worldwide.More info http://www.elinespeaks.com/Free Trial  https://itunes.apple.com/en/app/id955777526
info.risks and challenges: The risk is that the product is to 'cheap' for insurance companies & professional care advisors. An average speech computer costs 8,000 euro's. This App costs 100 euro's / year. We provide an 'Ikea' solution; Together we save money. We deliver a smart app for a very competitive price. You buy an iPad and install the app and you have a full fledged and user-friendly assistive technology solution./Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

data.blurb: ‘Eline Speaks’ is an Alternative and Augmentative Communication iPad App that helps people with disabilities communicate with ease.

data.name: Wonderful Mama Magazine

info.description: Wonderful Mama Magazine is currently run by myself, Emma Stewart, some wonderful writers, our lovely photographer, Steph, and now our marketing expert and mum of one, Sara. We are not a big team but we have a BIG heart. Wonderful Mama has been my biggest dream and I am beyond thrilled at how much support we have received. I am going to be honest with you, we are 6 months in and its come to a point where we've invested all (and I mean ALL) we have into Wonderful Mama and we just need a little extra help to get to where we want to be. ///Read our interview with the lovely Ada Nicodemou///With your pledge we will be able to spread our vision of helping as many mums as possible feel the way they should about themselves: to feel valued, confident, inspired and supported. /We know how tough (but rewarding obviously ;)) it is being a mum so at Wonderful Mama all we want to do is give mums a little time between changing nappies and school drop offs to read our mag, feel inspired and know that they're not alone on this crazy journey. That's why we would love to create a Wonderful Mama app. With this, mums have easier access to our articles, they can get behind the scenes access to interviews, added tips and can stay in touch with other mums while they're doing it. /Some of the money will also go towards hiring a proper office (instead of just working in the corner of my living room where my kids are constantly climbing over me asking for Peppa Pig!) where we can work, plan, have business meetings, photoshoots, and knuckle down to see real growth for Wonderful Mama. We will also use some of the funding to enable us to travel to your area and host events so we can connect with mums from around the world.////Read our fitness tips for exercising with the family///Although we do not have a physical product to offer, we have some fantastic rewards for pledges given along with the BIGGEST THANK YOU from the bottom of my heart. /Wonderful Mama is all about YOU as a mum, so if you feel inclined, I would be so honoured if you were to pledge towards being a part of our dream. I so appreciate you even taking the time to read this, and trust me I hate to be asking but we need your help to help other mamas feel the way they should./THANK YOU, THANK YOU, THANK YOU!/Emma x x x
info.risks and challenges: Potential challenges or set backs may be in the development of our app. Projects have time lines and we are well aware that things can pop up out of the blue and delay things. We have had some experience in developing apps and this was certainly the case. Being aware of this though and learning from previous projects has prepared us to be over detailed in our brief and not rely too much on timelines./Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

data.blurb: Wonderful Mama is an online magazine made just for mums and we need your help to take us to the next step in our adventure!

data.name: Lets do it - An Application of Hope

info.description: Let's Do It - An Application of HopeThere is a major problem of child labor and child beggary. The children are stolen from their parents and are forced into beggary and child labor. We decided to bring a change and started to come up with suggestions. We want to develop a phone application which has the potential to solve this problem. It's important to understand that so many children are losing out on their childhood due to this. It has been going on since so many years and now this has to stop. We need crowd collaboration and having this application on every phone is important. We will be working hard and continuously to help families unite. Be the change what you want to see in the world !!!!!Why we need it?/Many children are stolen from their families. And sometimes go missing./We want to change that, we want to bring in the change. "Let's do it" is an application and service that will bring about a new future for many families.How does it work?/Here are the steps In the application: The parent or the relative of the missing child will upload the photo of the child. Anyone who sees a child beggar will take his or her photo and will upload to our database with the location. We will use facial recognition technologies to match the pictures in our database. When there is a match, the application will inform the relative about the known location of the child. This will enable the police authorities to locate the child. It's an Application of Hope. /The Application will provide hope to millions of people who have lost their loved ones in this crowded world. The Application is crowdsourced and requires constant crowd involvement./We will use innovative ways to involve the crowd to be a part of it./This phone application is worldwide so can be used in any part of the world successfully.TOGETHER WE CAN AND WE WILL MAKE A DIFFERENCE !!!!!
info.risks and challenges: There are certainly few challenges. We need to have a world class application, so we will be working with the best experts in this field. We need constant maintenance of the server and the application, so the costs can be overcome by supporters and advertisers. We will need great face recognition technologies so we will be using the ones used by Google and Facebook. The eyes of a person don't change with time and this will be an important factor in this application to make the match even after several years. We are sure that this application will prove to be a very helpful tool for millions of families and will bring about a positive change to the lives of millions of children./Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

data.blurb: Let's bring a positive change. We want to develop a phone application that will help families unite with their lost loved ones.

data.name: Your Backup Plan Mobile App

info.description: WHAT IS YOUR BACKUP PLAN!?/YOUR BACKUP PLAN MOBILE APP is an app that will organize all of your pieces of your life easily in 1-place in a system so when the disaster or tragedy hits, the APP will recover all of your information needed.Easy to access with the push of a button, from anywhere with a safe contingent plan built right into the system to protect your private information from theft. With/so many disasters coming your way how can you possibly recover from them everywhere/at any time?We/don’t get up in the morning to plan for a tragedy, or a disaster. They just/happen.Whether/you are single or have a partner, everyone’s Life puzzle is complicated and/unique. Your family or friends may not know all the details of your puzzle but/when tragedy hits your life – your family or friends will need a very quick/recovery to that valuable information!That’s/when Your Backup Plan enables you and your family to put your life’s puzzle/back together.This/video will show you how our BETA works...DOWNLOADING THE APP AND STARTINGStoring your information is 1-encrypted within the program and then stored where you choose to store it.//////////You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.//////Play////////////////////////////Replay with sound//////////Play with  sound/////////////00:00///00:00//////////////////////////////// STEP 2 CREATING YOUR PROFILE///////You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.//////Play////////////////////////////Replay with sound//////////Play with  sound/////////////00:00///00:00//////////////////////////////// STEP 3 ADDING IN YOUR DOCUMENTS AND PHOTOS///////You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.//////Play////////////////////////////Replay with sound//////////Play with  sound/////////////00:00///00:00//////////////////////////////// Here’s how to do it the e-z way://Use an iFlash Drive to transfer files. This is a spacious drive (up to 16GB) that lets you quickly transfer files between your phone and your laptop. One end connects to your phone, the other a USB./Use an EyeFi SD card to wirelessly send vids straight from your DSLR and onto your phone. (IT DOES THAT.) You can see how it works in the vid above!/Use an app like Dropbox (Android & iOS) or Cloud to store videos in internet-space and download it on whatever device you want, whenever you need it. If you have a iThingies, you can also use iCloud to sync your files across computers and devices.Creating your Profile and your Guest Login/Create your Profile/Create your Guest Profile with an email to the guest account and they must respond to accept/The Owner's account will always have an email sent to it when ever the APP is opened by anyone other than their account/You may choose to have a Guest account with a professional, family or friend/Your added information is not stored on the APP. The APP is only the framework for organizing and retrieving the information for you.  The APP will encrypt the information./You must choose an appropriate storage of your documents, the APP will ask you where you will store the information./Currently there are- USB, cloud, or backup service in your own City, or external hard drive./So, security is utmost important.////////You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.//////Play////////////////////////////Replay with sound//////////Play with  sound/////////////00:00///00:00//////////////////////////////// ///// ///// ///// /WHY DO WE NEED THIS?  WHY BACKUP YOUR LIFE?This APP has been the answer to creating a personal fully functional quick response to tragedy and disaster! This has been my passion for over 10 years to help families take away the anguish, sadness and emotional shock of all of the things that you need to do when that person either becomes very sick, injured, or passes away.  It's really difficult to get the information from an elderly parent or relative/friend when they don't think they are going to pass away. "Oh no, nothing is going to happen like that," they say. So they don't want to face it and tell you anything. And when it's a tragic accident, they can't tell you. So I initially wrote a book and a workbook to start the process. I was shocked and saddened by one of the biggest hurdles facing families is when it comes time of crisis the family and friends don't have access to all of the details of that person's life puzzle needed to either complete or plan their final estate. Or to be able to continue on with their day-to-day workload that has been left for others to complete for them. It evolved and become a system even larger than that! Even for disasters, theft and crisis!It amazed me when we researched how our grand parents and generations before would keep and store important documents and ensure those that were left behind were secure. They would roll up all of the special forms, documents and information in a brown paper bag and stick in the rafters to keep it safe, just like in the movie, "Charlie and the Chocolate Factory".So, I was determined to change this and create a functional yet innovative APP that would be safe but easy to have on your tablet or phone so you would access it when you need to. Hence, Your Backup Plan Mobile App!WHERE WE ARE AT:Here's where we are at with the Beta Version of Your Backup Plan App:/Fully functional Beta Version/1st Release Date scheduled for June 1st, 2015/Concentration with storage and security of all information/Our personal savings and countless hours invested/Now we need the money to take the YOUR BACKUP PLAN MOBILE APP from the beta version to the release date which includes the following costs:1- Development process $ 2,0002- Security consultation and integration $ 5,0003- Production of the final release to all of the various /     platforms $ 3,000/COME JOIN US AND HUNDREDS OF FAMILIES TO SPREAD THE WORD, AND GET YOUR BACKUP PLAN STARTED!
info.risks and challenges: Risks and challenges/We have the team in place, and we're ready to go. We launched the Beta of YOUR BACKUP PLAN in 2012 to a great welcome from the community in a workbook and binder system. We've had the whole year to gather insight from our users — and build from our initial prototype./We've mapped out an astonishingly simple and helpful new version of YOUR BACKUP PLAN in a simple but extremely organized system in an APP version because IOS technology has evolved dramatically. Now Your Backup Plan code needs a framework built for all platforms to integrate for top of the line newest technology security. While concentrating on "simple and easy to use" and leaving "nothing to chance" we are currently building the next beta. Including a framework to encrypt your uploaded information, add it to a storage platform of your choice, and then the app will be able to access it with a push of a button after entering your secure login in an organized system./Whatever challenges arise, we have the experience and expertise to tackle them and get Your Backup Plan App into your hands./Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

data.blurb: Puts your life in 1-place in preparation of any unpredictable circumstance while taking the painful aftermath out of any tragedy

data.name: Princess Cut: A young girl's reality inside a TN sex ring

info.description: Princess Cut:/A young girl's reality inside a Tennessee sex ring/was created to /shed light on a dark,/but true,/story /about/sex trafficking. Our play follows a /young woman, "Sarah", as she relives memories of /first /being victimized by a /family member at the age of /5, of/then /being /introduced into what they called a /"real estate ring", and /of /later/learning/to live a double life as the psychological /trauma caught up with her. /Princess Cut/explores what sex trafficking really looks /like/here in the United States/and how /our /society/has failed/to recognize and /address this problem, leaving/little girls like "Sarah" to fall through the cracks. Princess Cut/is a play born from a need. The subject of sex trafficking,/especially /of children,/is one so repulsive many choose to /turn a blind eye. /This show /brings /the issue more clearly /to light. Done with the support of a /Greek-style chorus, the /narrative is tastefully executed with the aid of music and movement. The /audience is allowed to delve into the unnerving story of this one girl, from her /perspective, and is/unable to walk away without /seeing the issue more clearly. This show/allows opportunity for discussion. /A/question and answer session with /a panel of professionals follows each /performance, /giving/the audience /action /steps to fight sex trafficking within/their own communities. First performed in /Knoxville, TN, where this story took place, the show and panel /bluntly call/out /failing institutions and the language surrounding issues of abuse. In the months /following its premier, /repeat /performances were requested in Loudon, /Nashville,/and again in Knoxville, TN./In each location, /Princess Cut/forced its/audience to /have a good,/hard look at the /cities/in which they live.The New York International Fringe /Festival /is one of the largest multi-arts events in North America. It is an ideal platform for original and innovative theatre, and each year, FringeNYC accepts around two hundred applicants from the thousands it receives. Last month, we found out that Princess Cut was accepted to FringeNYC and now has the amazing opportunity to share Sarah's story with a larger audience. This show has already impacted the communities in which it was performed, and we are confident that it will continue to do so on a larger scale. Our company, Yellow Rose Productions, is passionate about producing theatre that provokes social change and promotes empathy in our audience. We /use theatre such as Princess Cut to deliver an /incredible narrative,/while simultaneously educating and raising awareness about /an important issue. Help us bring Sarah's story to FringeNYC. It is our hope that launching this Kickstarter will cover the costs of bringing our cast and crew to NYC for five performances of Princess Cut. After creating our budget and considering travel, food, lodging, promotion and production costs for our cast and crew of twelve, we realized that we needed to ask for financial help. We understand that there are countless projects that are worth funding, and we appreciate your consideration. Thank you for taking the time to check out our campaign and for joining us in bringing Sarah's story to a larger audience. Building awareness and recognition is how we are committed to fighting sex trafficking. Danielle Roos/and /Kerri Koczen Yellow Rose Productions yellowroseproductions.org
info.risks and challenges: The risks and challenges we face after becoming successfully funded are ones we are prepared to tackle. In the past, we have traveled with this show and we understand what challenges come with a new location. It can be difficult to put on a show in a theater venue we have not been to before. We also face the challenges of organizing and coordinating travel for twelve people. We are also solely responsible for promotion and drawing an audience in a city in which we have never produced. /This show was originally meant as a one night only production. Since its premier, we have tackled the challenges of producing the show in three different cities, and are fully confident in our ability to do it again on a larger scale./Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

data.blurb: An original theatrical production using music, movement and monologues to tell the story of a TN native growing up within a sex ring.

data.name: The Piano Man

info.description: The True Story/In 2005 a suited man washed up on the Kent coast with no recollection of where he came from, how he got there or who he was. He could not speak. No one could recognise him. But he could play Tchaikovsky... Inspired by real-life events, AllthePigs Theatre Company discover the story behind 'The Piano Man' Andreas Grassl. Silent for four months, the world speculated about his identity - from the doctors who treated him, to the press who vilified him as a fraud, and to the countless people worldwide who claimed to know him./////AllthePigs Theatre Company are an award-winning collective who bring you theatre that is unpretentious, fun, relevant and pressure-free. As we like to put it, we make theatre for the audience. /Our Aims/In our quest to create a show that would have the legs to travel across the UK, we came across the extraordinary true story of The Piano Man - Andreas Grassl. The Piano Man's plight captured the world's imagination when it made international news in 2005, and we hope it will prove equally fascinating to audiences across the UK nearly ten years on. Our aim is to bring this story to life in an exciting, engaging and magical way for audiences not only in London, but in a variety of communities across the UK. Our tight-knit ensemble and flexible set design will enable us to perform in theatres, arts centres, abandoned buildings, and even on the odd beach!/About Us/AllthePigs have become known for working with young first-time writers and giving them their first experience of the industry; but when it came to The Piano Man we wanted to bring everything in-house and devise the show as a company. Our previous successes with devised work include two five-star rated shorts at The Vaults, but this will be our first full-length devised piece to date. We are asking for £1000 to go towards the Research and Development of this production. This sum will allow us to pay our actors for their time ahead of rehearsals, and will enable us to make this show the best it can possibly be. "AllthePigs seem to pin theatre right back down to its roots and remind us why we go in the first place." The LondonistThis production is supported by:The New Diorama Emerging Companies Fund, The Vaults London, Exeter University Psychology Department, King's College London Trauma Department. 2014 PERFORMANCES: 11th - 15th November at The New Diorama. 2015 PERFORMANCES: Dates to be announced soon. A BIG BIG thank you from the Pigs. If you make it to the show, please come and say hi! ///Danny, Sarah, Chris, Sam and Ami (in that order)/// Pssstttt... You can buy tickets to the show here: http://newdiorama.com/whats-on/the-piano-man
info.risks and challenges: As this our first full-length devised show, we will be previewing the production in November 2014 for one week in London, at The New Diorama Theatre. This is to ensure the production is running smoothly, and to see what audiences think of it! /At this preview week we'll also be inviting industry professionals, producers, national venues and potential sponsors to help make the most of this opportunity. /After the initial run in London we will have until February 2015 to finalise plans for the tour and iron out any problems that arose from the audience feedback. /The tour is almost booked, but there may be additional dates or venues added at this time. (By the way, if you'd like us to perform in a theatre - or any other space near you - please do email us!)/Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

data.blurb: The real-life story of the mysterious 'Piano Man' who washed ashore with no memory; with no speech; but with an amazing ability...

data.name: ACOrN: A Crunch Or None --> Edinburgh Fringe!

info.description: Lorraine, Esbe and David have reached ACOrN, the penultimate level of a simulation game designed to test their performing abilities. After 45 attempts, they are wilting and exploding. They have rehearsed a thousand plays, and flit madly between them in order to appease the Master. They have jumped from Aristotelian narrative to Brechtian balderdash, searched inside Beckett’s bum and found nothing. In search of a new plane, they’ll dance – frenetic and frenzied – over a world full feta to find something better. Will they see daylight again? Come, humour their metatheatrical nutshell volcano./Nay, please help fund their volcano!We want to create a surreal, enrapturing set - the pixellated innards of the simulation game. Using glowing cubes, each representing one pixel of the characters' prison, we will surround them in their world. Large glowing white cubes will serve as chairs and pedestals. We'd like to minimise (ideally not use at all) stage lighting, to make the fictional world completely immersive and eliminate (when appropriate) the Stageness of the stage.In terms of costume, we also have ambitious plans. It seems only fitting that the game (set in a dysto-utopian some-sort-of-future where performance can be scored and quantified) has a suitably silly uniform. The three Tron-clad performers will glow and flash, with neon lining and... VELCRO. Props and costume will be fastened onto each character to facilitate the 'flit-flitting' - jumping from one character to another by the donning of military stripes, a stethoscope, a thermometer. Appropriately made-up with pixellated faces, our players will surely look the part. Base layers, velcro, neon lights, head torches, avatars, make-up...these all need funding!We also have the Grandmaester to think about. Maddened magician-cum-trickster, a many-faced wizard, Grandmaester Mandala has many guises. These are in the works (as is her surprise instrument!), and will no doubt be aptly spectacular and spectacularly silly - with your help!We have created a show which challenges audience, art, the act of acting and the action of direction. Scripting in swathes of improvisation, we've captured three competitors (actors, directors, participants in the Game) in genuine flux and dynamism. Exciting and slightly different every time, this show will definitely, defiantly, entertain to the max. Please help us make sure it does!
info.risks and challenges: We're working very hard to make the most of every day available to us as a full cast - there aren't many days until the 15th (when we go up to Edinburgh), and we're only all together for half of them! But, alas and butt, we're on it like a car bonnet. We'll make it happen. /The difference YOUR donation can make is to render costume, prop and set construction less of an obstacle. We've already invested £150+ of personal funds into the project. The rest of the money will go towards creating a fantastic world - in the time that we have. We must also transport the entire set to Edinburgh from London. Just one more challenge!/Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

data.blurb:
1 game, 7 levels, 45 attempts; Lorraine, Esbe & David; 1 Grandmaester.

data.name: And Now: The World!

info.description: ! Stop Press !We have reached our initial goal of £3,000 so we are setting 2 Stretch Goals - one for £800, and another for £750 - so we can make the show even cooler. Scroll down for more information about the project and our Stretch Goals.The Play//"We want to be supermodels or get on TV, because otherwise we'll just sit at our computers anonymously hating each other."And Now:The World! is about being young in a digital world; about being a superhero caught in a web; about being able to spend more time with your friends online than face to face.  If your whole life is online, can you start a feminist revolution and stay #ontrend?/ /The internet is a world of possibilities, but what happens to humans when we get information overload and our interface points don’t overlap?  ! WARNING !  OpenWorks Theatre are NOT putting the internet on stage. We are staging the effect of the internet on human beings. Expect an unfamiliar visual language, arresting imagery and unusual devices./Public Performance Dates:/Platform Youth Hub, Islington, 24-25th September/Derby Theatre, 2nd October/The Moor (Sheffield), 15th-17th October/The Edge (Manchester), 23rd-24th October/Hackney Showroom, 27th-31st October/Bristol Tobacco Factory Theatre, 2nd-4th November/Travelling Light Community Centre, Bristol  7th November/Arts Centre Washington, 12th November/Education and Outreach work:In partnership with Platform Youth Hub in Islington, we are providing 5 paid traineeships for local young people. Roles include trainee director, trainee designer, trainee lighting designer, trainee sound design and trainee stage manager. They will spend half a day a week with us in rehearsals, attend all production meetings, be there for tech week. They will have the option of being mentored by the relevant member of the creative/production team. The trainees will act as ambassadors for the shows at Platform, at their schools/colleges and for the shows at Hackney Showroom. They will give out word-of-mouth only discount codes to first time theatre goers.In partnership with Derby Theatre, we are providing one week of intensive traineeships for 5 young people in care.  As we enter into our fourth week of rehearsal in Derby, we will explore their response to the play, share our process with them, pass on our skills and offer them traineeships and mentoring with relevant creative team members. They will also act as ambassadors for our performance at Derby Theatre, where their peers have the option of coming for free through the theatre's plus one scheme.In addition to this, we are doing 5 in-school performances (3 in London, 2 in Bristol) and 1 performance in a community centre in BS5 (Bristol). We will run free pre-show workshops and post show discussions and workshops in all 6 of these venues. New Stretch Goals:The first £3,000 will cover thet extra money needed to make sure the show looks as good in a school as it will in a theatre, and it covers the cost of our amazing production manager who will make sure our set is tourable,1. We want to try and raise an extra £800 to pay for an amazing PA to make sure the show sounds as BOOM-TASTIC in every single venue.2. We would like to raise an extra £750 to pay for an awesome operating desk to make it possible to operate the show to a professional standard in non-theatre spaces.OpenWorks Theatre:///Leila Mimmack in OpenWorks' DEBRIS 2014. Photo by Richard Davenport///OpenWorks believes:1. Excellent art should be available to everyone / /2. Everyone should have the opportunity to make excellent art./ /3. The wider the range of people who make art, the more reflective of society and the more relavent it will be./ /So, our audience development and outreach work are integrated into all our work from inception to delivery./ /Why do we do it?/ 28% of people go to the theatre because of word of mouth./ /The biggest barrier for non theatre goers is the price./ /Basically...We're bored of seeing the same type of work made by the same type of people for the same type of people./ /How do we do it?/ /We make it easier for word of mouth to spread and make cheap tickets easily available. / /What?!/ /OpenWorks creates a new theatre going audience by involving them in the production from the beginning./ /With DEBRIS we piloted a scheme which does just this. It involved work experience for 9 young people from the local community and a word-of-mouth-only discount code for first time theatre goers.//With And Now:The World! we are giving paid work experience to 10 young people (5 in London and 5 in Derby). In return, they will act as ambassadors for the show to their peers./ /Oh, and by giving a total of 330 free tickets away to young people from schools/colleges/youth organisations in ALL 6 CITIES, it is our hope that they may tell their friends and family to see it at to their local arts venue. We'll keep you posted.Results:/ /41 people who had never been to the theatre independently came because of this scheme.  114 young people who had never been to Southwark Playhouse before came because they were given exclusive online discount codes for first time bookers/ .We are looking forward to seeing the new audience data for And Now: The World! /For more information please go to www.openworkstheatre.co.uk The Creative Team:Playwright - Sibylle Berg was born in East Germany and lives in Zurich. She has published numerous novels and plays, and her work has been translated into 26 languages. In 2014 She received Theatre Heute Play of the Year Award for And Now: The World!//Her other plays include - A few people seek happiness and laugh themselves to death (2000, based on her novel of the same name), Helge's Life (2001), Dog, Woman, Man (2002) and The Golden recent years werewolf nominated for the most prestigious award for German speaking playwrights, the Mülheim Dramatists' Award. In 2008 she received the Wolfgang-Koeppen-Literaturpreis. //Her novels include include - A few people seek happiness and laugh themselves to death (Reclam Leipzig, 1997), Sex II (Reclam Leipzig, 1998), America (Hoffmann und Campe, 1999), The Unpleasant first - Mr. stories (Kiepenheuer and Petrovich, 2001), Ends Well (Kiepenheuer and Petrovich, 2004), the ride (Kiepenheuer & Petrovich, 2007), the Man Sleeps (Roman, Hanser Verlag, 2009 - nominated for the German book Prize), Thank you very much for Life (Hanser Verlag, 2012 - nominated for the Swiss book Prize).Director- Abigail Graham.Work as Director includes: Timmy Failure: Mistakes Were made (assembly Rooms, Edinburgh 2015) Lines in The Sand (Soho),Black Sheep (Soho); DEBRIS (Southwark Playhouse); Molly Sweeney (Print Room, London and Lyric Theatre Belfast and Northern Irish Tour); Agent 160,Four Short Plays (UK tour); The Censor  (JMK Award Runner Up, Young Vic); Blue Heaven – Three Short Plays by Tennessee Williams (Finborough Theatre); Jacks Quest (Company of Angels Theatre Makers Award winner.); The Boy and The Dog Who Walked to the Moon (Pleasance, Edinburgh.)Abigail has also directed large scale community theatre projects for the Almeida, Young Vic theatres.Dramaturge- Clara Brennan As a playwright her work has been performed at the Soho Theatre, Southwark Playhouse, York Theatre Royal, The Duke's Theatre, the Arcola Theatre and the Traverse Theatre. //In 2012, she was awarded the OffWestEnd Adopt a Playwright Award for her play The Vendor. //Other stage work includes Spine which premiered to critical acclaim, including winning a Fringe First, at the Edinburgh Fringe 2014 and then had a run at Soho Theatre. Her play Boa was shown at Trafalgar Studios starring Harriet Walter earlier this year.Designer - Sarah Beaton/ is a UK based designer working in theatre, opera and dance./She studied Design for Stage at The Royal Central School of Speech & Drama, graduating in 2011 with First Class Honours./In 2011, Sarah was awarded The Linbury Prize for Stage Design. She was nominated for the Arts Foundation Fellowship 2013 by Katrina Lindsay and was selected to exhibit her work at World Stage Design 2013 in Cardiff./Recent Theatre Work includes: Crocodiles (Manchester Royal Exchange), The Good Person of Setzuan (CSSD, Directed by Nancy Meckler), Missing (Underbelly, 2013, Scottish Daily Mail Best Drama Award), Diary of A MadMan (Living Pictures Welsh tour) Babur in London (Sadler's Wells/Opera Group) and house on the edge (jerwood dance house)./Translator -  Ben Knight has lived in Berlin for 14 years. He translated Sibylle Berg's most recent novel "Vielen Dank für das Leben," published in 2014 by Thames River Press under the title "Thank You For This Life." He has also translated several screenplays for the production company Schiwago Films, and previously worked in theatre, directing plays in German and English.Production Manager  - Sam Paterson is a freelance production manager. Over his extensive career, he has worked in subsidised, touring, commercial theatre and international transfers of UK work. He has worked for The Young Vic, Headlong Chichester Festival Theatre, ATG, and most recently The Children’s Theatre Partnership on the tour of Boy in the Striped Pyjamas.Producer - Ania was Assistant Producer for Actors Touring Company. Prior to this, she worked as as a freelance arts producer and manager for LIFT (London International Festival of Theatre), Katie Mitchell and Shunt. Ania completed MA in Arts Administration and/Cultural Policy at Goldsmiths. She previously studied performing arts in France and Poland. Associate Producer and Voice of Youth - Desara Bosnja is currently working as an Apprentice Producer at the Bush Theatre as part of the LTC Apprenticeship Schemes. Prior to joining The Bush, Desara was an Artistic Director on the Young Friends of the Almeida Creative Board for four years where she co-curated the YFA Almeida Festival in 2011. In 2012 she became Young Producer at the BAC for 6 months, where she supported the Freshly Scratched Festival in December 2012 & produced Brave New World in March 2013. Desara also has experience in Community Arts after Project Assisting at All Change (Community Arts Organisation in Islington). Desara won Runner Up Young Achiever Award in the Arts in 2010.
info.risks and challenges: There are the usual risks with theatre productions: the van could break down, the technical rehearsal could over-run by hours, the actor could decide that she won't come out of her dressing rooms./However, we are all experienced theatre makers. Abigail has directed shows in theatres across London and Northern Ireland, and in schools, community centres and on housing estates across London and the South East./Sarah has designed shows in London, Scotland, Manchester and one which toured all over Wales. /Sam is one of the best production managers in the business. He has over 20 years of production management experience. He has just finished production managing the UK tour of Boy in the Striped Pyjamas. Basically, we are in safe hands. /Our amazing producer Ania has produced tours for Actors Touring Company which have been all over the UK, Europe and beyond./Theatre is a wholly human art form. Things will go wrong. But we have the team who know how to handle it when they do./Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
