data.name: The Commission Theatre Co.

info.description: Who we areThe Commission Theater Company is a Shakespeare company with a twist.  Each season we will produce fully developed Shakespearean plays, and New Works inspired by those plays.  In dedicating ourselves to Shakespeare, we must also encourage the very profession he was immortalizing. Shakespeare is two things: a body of work, and a playwright.  We do not believe in rewriting Shakespeare, but we do believe in elevating the playwright. Shakespeare stole from Marlow, Marlow stole from Kyd, and all of them stole from popular history. We would like to give new playwrights that same opportunity for theft. Help us bring Shakespeare back to the playwrights. /The Commission Theater Company is dedicated to these ideals: -We will produce the works of William Shakespeare -We will work to honor and understand the verse, and in turn bring it clearly to the audience-We will encourage and elevate the playwright-We will give playwrights an avenue to create new work inspired by Shakespeare 			theme’s, language, and stories./////Our First SeasonThe season will begin with a production of Love's Labour's Lost. A story about young love, smart men, and smarter women. Running August 12th - 16th at Piven Theater in Evanston, IL.	Next up will be a staged reading of Henry IV, Part I. Join Prince Hal and Falstaff for a pint of ale at their favorite watering hole. A tavern style reading, with food, drink, and plenty of laughs. The Shakespeare Commission: An opportunity for theft. We'll ask a contemporary playwright what about Love's Labour's Lost or Henry 4 part 1 inspires them (a theme, character, verse, etc.), and ask them to take that spark and make a new work. We'll workshop it, and end in a staged reading.
info.risks and challenges: Starting a new business, in today's economic market, is an enormous undertaking. Starting that business in the arts is even more of a challenge. We are very fortunate to be establishing our home in a city that takes great pride in its artists. That being said, there is strong competition within Chicago in terms of new, exciting theatre. It is no secret to say, new theater companies live and die within their first few years. They are finding their voices, testing the waters. But those vulnerable years are a time of necessary growth. The challenges we will face extend beyond this first season of plays. Primarily, in establishing a solid financial groundwork, managing those funds, and developing an audience base. /While all of us forming this company are artists, we are also entrepreneurs, and that is how we must view this venture. Every dollar we make is an investment into an aesthetic we have pledged to maintain. We will be called upon to use our backgrounds in managing, marketing, and producing as much as we will be called upon for acting, writing and directing. It is important to merge our artistic and small business owner sensibilities. /The four of us, have diverse backgrounds in arts and in business management. Much like our art, collaboration will help us survive the ever changing model that is a storefront theater./Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

data.blurb: Bringing Shakespeare back to the Playwrights

data.name: PICNIC, by William Inge: An Inaugural Production

info.description: Seat of the Pants Productions has been producing unique, high quality theater over the last 10 years in a variety of cities and spaces - everything ranging from a production of Cotton Patch Gospel starring students with Downs Syndrome, to a production of God of Carnage which raised funds to support anti-bullying initiatives in the public schools, to an entirely homegrown puppet opera of Mary Shelley's Frankenstein.Each initiative has been funded by Kickstarter, executed by many hard-working and dedicated folks, and well-received by the community.Now, the ensemble has an exciting opportunity to put down some roots, establish a permanent performance home, and expand the work we do.We've been invited by The Plain Local Community Center for the Arts to use their black box theater for a production this summer. This board of folks is creatively discovering ways for their state-of-the-art high school facility (which includes a medical clinic and a branch of the county library) to function as a community center for folks beyond the high school. Part of this plan involves offering high-caliber performances in several disciplines, and we've been asked to provide theatre. We've been invited to use the space and - if all goes well - establish an ongoing summer theatrical season in the space when it's not in use by the students.It's a tremendous and exciting opportunity, so we want to make sure that we knock it out of the park. And so, we're turning to Kickstarter to help underwrite a production of an American classic, PICNIC, by William Inge.///Costume Research by Inda Blatch-Geib///Set in Kansas in the early 50s, it's the story of a small community getting geared up to celebrate Labor Day with a town picnic. As summer comes to an end, the women (and men) in town find their humdrum routine upset by the presence of a drifter, who ignites passions in all sorts of directions, forcing folks to come to terms with love, desire, and sex.Monies already raised through previous ticket sales and a small grant are going toward publicity materials, lighting equipment, royalties, and ticketing costs.The funds we're requesting through Kickstarter will largely underwrite costumes, scenic construction, and properties. Now that we're in an actual theatrical space - as opposed to some of our guerrilla tactics on previous productions - we're trying to raise the production value a bit.Getting this production paid for up front will allow 100% of ticket revenue to go into a kitty for next year's production, ideally getting us stable footing in what we hope will be our new artistic home.We hope you'll consider supporting this project, sharing it with your friends, and then joining us for PICNIC, August 21-30, in Canton, Ohio! (Tickets at www.translationsart.com/picnic)  A simple $15 from everyone invited to donate would put us over the top! And remember - we have 30 days to make this happen - and we either raise ALL of it, or we get NONE of it!Thanks for reading and considering!
info.risks and challenges: The biggest risks and challenges of the project involve this being our first time working in a new space on a tight timeframe. While we have estimates of what the set will cost to build, what sort of instrumentation we need to light the space, and how to amplify sound, none of us really knows./We're, of course, also building a new relationship with the school district and navigating what we can and can't do to the space, what resources are available to us, and just generally building trust./To prep for all possible snafus in these arenas, we've put a couple of things into place:/1) Our producer - this time around - is the drama teacher from the high school, someone who both knows and understands our needs, but also can be a good liaison with the school and represent their concerns./2) We've earmarked a slush fund of money that is not budgeted toward anything for if we suddenly run into unexpected costs./3) We are keeping a regular production log to note things that can be improved upon or done better in the future. The goal is to schedule a post mortem after the process to ensure that - if this does become our permanent home - this things can be smoothed over next time around./4) And quite simply, we've assembled a killer team of performers and designers who excel at new situations and contexts, and who will be able to navigate all this new stuff while still producing quality theatre./Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

data.blurb: Seat of the Pants mounts our first show in a black box space that could become permanent; can you help us excel and seal the deal?

data.name: Sugarglass Theatre

info.description: “Dizzyingly ambitious… wonderfully inventive and richly immersive… Heavenly.” - The Irish Times/Sugarglass is a theatre company committed to the creation of new work, true international collaboration and theatre that is visually striking - helping us to see the everyday through a new lens.2016 marks a pivotal moment in the company’s history as it launches its first full-scale production in the US. The NYC premiere of David Greig’s Outlying Islands explores the themes of isolation, human freedom and climactic catastrophe - ideas which are vital to explore right now. Contributing to this campaign will help us to continue to achieve our goal, connecting communities across the world and engaging a whole new set of artists with our home team in Ireland. With your help we can continue to create connections as contemporary circumstances conspire to pull us further apart.In Greig's play, everything is on the edge. It is 1939 and the world trembles on the brink of war, the end of innocence. Two fresh-faced Cambridge ornithologists arrive on a remote island to conduct a survey of the birds for the government. At least, that is what Robert and his assistant John think they are doing.—————————————————————————————We ask what it means to live in a truly global world by creating productions that balance specific stories with wide reaching thematic impact. Sugarglass works under a shared ideal that the work it produces can offer an unexpected reflection of our contemporary society.Our productions are created through a uniquely collaborative process between director, designers and actors, making muscular work that can be impactful in our transient times.Sugarglass was founded in 2012 and has six core members, all of whom met at Trinity College Dublin. Company members have been selected for numerous awards and honours including the Irish Times Theatre Awards, The Next Stage at the Dublin Theatre Festival and the Jennifer Johnstone and Elizabeth Tuckerman Scholarships.“Sugarglass are divinely intervening in the conventional theatre-going experience.” - Musings in Intermissions
info.risks and challenges: We are committed to a production that runs from March 30th - April 2nd. Failure to raise the necessary funding will mean that we unfortunately will not be able to fully realise the design elements of the set we have envisioned, nor will we be able to fairly compensate the artists involved./Any contribution to this campaign will help in both the artistic and logistic execution of Outlying Islands, but does not necessarily mean that the production will have a life that is longer than the initial 5 performance run./Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

data.blurb: Sugarglass is a Dublin based theatre company committed to international collaboration. 2016 sees the launch of their NYC division.

data.name: Bring Bigger, Badder BRIEF HISTORY Back To The Stage!

info.description: Yes!  We're bringing it back!  This Spring we're remounting a BRAND-NEW, FULL-LENGTH version of the Dave Rabinow and Victoria Dorazio's original musical A BRIEF HISTORY OF THE EARTH AND EVERYTHING IN IT (AS PERFORMED BY MS. LOPICCOLO'S THIRD-GRADE DRAMA GROUP FROM THE WILLIAM JENNINGS BRYAN ELEMENTARY SCHOOL IN SPRINGFIELD, MISSOURI) !Since premiering ABHOTE in 2011 as part of our Go.Go.5 festival,ETC has been looking for a chance to remount a bigger, badder version of this story of third-grade drama students and secular humanists fighting to reclaim their school from the insidious forces of right-wing Christian fundamentalism. We are so excited to be bringing it back this June at the luxurious Gamm Theatre! But we NEED YOUR HELP!  This show is our biggest project to date, and we've got some of the best and brightest names in the Rhode Island performing arts working to make you laugh, sing, and question the existence of a higher power, including director Tyler Dobrowsky (Associate Artistic Director, Trinity Rep), actors Karen Carpenter and Casey Seymour Kim (resident artists, Gamm Theatre), and music director Esther Zabinski (Ocean State Theatre). Join the revolution! Be a part of ETC as we fight for science, reason, and the inalienable right to hysterical musical theater!
info.risks and challenges: We at ETC are committed to seeing this project through; our dates at the Gamm have been locked down, contracts have been signed, and the ball is inexorably rolling towards production. 2014 marks Elemental's TENTH year producing professional-quality original productions at below-market ticket prices. We believe that our work should be accessible to ANYONE who wants to be a part of it, and using the Gamm is a huge step in helping us make our work available to a wider audience. Whatever challenges we could face post-funding, we feel that, because of our history, experience, and demonstrated commitment to our artists and our audience, we are uniquely suited to overcome them. As a donor, you can trust that every dollar you give will be used expressly for this project, and will help us to meet whatever challenges arise./Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

data.blurb: We're remounting the musical that brought down the Bush Administration: A Brief History of the Earth And Everything In It!

data.name: Ray Gunn and Starburst

info.description: About Ray Gunn and StarburstRay Gunn and Starburst is a sci-fi comedy about two unlikely heroes finding their way in a galaxy ruled by a shockingly evil corporation called Darkleys. Tale as old as time, yes? Well, exactly, sci-fi/adventure stories are built on tropes and stereotypes, so how about taking all those tropes and mixing them up a bit. Let’s take away that dashing space pirate captain and replace him with a newly divorced forty-something, living in a wreck of a spaceship and completely unable to hold his own in a fight. On top of that he’s been dragged along with a rowdy teenage girl, who has heroism quite literally written through her DNA and her broken AI, made more of sarcasm than binary coding, and you have a recipe for disaster...uh, I mean, adventure. Ray may have absolutely no wish to become a hero but he hasn’t quite ruled out the idea of being a sidekick. Set in the year 2005 (as all the best sci-fi classics are), newly divorced, Raymond Gunn finds himself lying flat on his back in some seedy bar, on some seedy asteroid, in some seedy corner of galaxy, when suddenly Starburst and her AI, S.U.I.T (Survival Utility Intelligence Technology) burst into his life, with adventure, heroism and maybe a bit of blackmail on their minds. Cue the beginning of the rest of his life. Will Starburst break away from her dangerously, shady past? Will Ray ever manage to fix his space ship? Will the narrator actually be allowed to finish a story without irritating protagonists interrupting? Well you’ll have to give us some money to find out. Listen to our audio trailer below, featuring the marvellous voice acting talent of our awesome cast!/////And our exciting new series trailer://///The basic idea behind the series is to send up classic science-fiction, such as Flash Gordon, Buck Rodgers, etc. I have always loved classic pulp sci-fi, the wonderfully over the top nature, the heroes ripping off their shirts, quirky robots, saving the day and doing some derring-do; all of that is full of comedic value. I also wanted to create something that felt pulpy and old school radio but with a modern twist, to take all of the classic tropes and mix them up a bit, and perhaps break the fourth wall into tiny pieces and dance on its grave. /The first episode was written as part of my final year project at University and I was lucky enough to be offered the chance to record that as a rough cut pilot. (link below) I went on to write a six episode series, and the recording of those episodes is what this Kickstarter will be funding, . //PILOT LINK /When the project is complete you will be able to find and download it for free on iTunes and our website (link to follow). You will also be able to purchase the CD from the website shop, as well as other Ray Gunn and Starburst merchandise./Cast and Crew/Open auditions were held, inviting people from all across the UK to take part in Ray Gunn and Starburst. From all those who sent in audition tapes the people you see below were the best of the best and we are all looking forward to working together. //////Rewards/The rewards are, of course, listed down the side of the page but here are just a few examples of what we will be offering. ////Standard logo badge//////Exclusive Kickstarter badge//////Ray Gunn and Starburst cotton tote-bag//////Exclusive Ray Gunn and Starburst Kickstarter shirt///The prints we are offering are by cast member and artist for Orang Utan Comics David Wynne, Roller Girls artist Gary Erskine and Doctor Who and Marvel Artist Mike Collins////The First Exclusive print by David Wynne///Costs// /Now, it does seem like a lot of money for a simple radio drama, but we wanted to create a really professional product and to thank everyone who got involved properly. //This chart gives a brief overview of the costs involved and why we need quite so much. ////Cost breakdown/// We are bringing all of the cast and crew to one location in Cardiff, Wales, to record. They are going to have to travel from all over the UK but it will mean that we are able to work in a completely professional environment, and the cast will be able to work together rather than recording separately and losing some of the drama in the scripts. We will spend four days working together, doing read throughs, recordings and pick ups all in that time. //Unfortunately, in the UK we have to pay a tax called Value Added Tax and that is costing us quite a lot.
info.risks and challenges: The only risks to the project are any of the cast and crew getting ill, data corruption to the recordings and acts of God. /None of the rewards will be affected by this, save for the CD but it would still be made and sent out eventually./Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

data.blurb: Ray Gunn and Starburst is an audio sci-fi/comedy sending up the tropes of classic and pulp science-fiction.

data.name: BULL by Mike Bartlett at the Coal Mine Theatre

info.description: The Toronto Premiere of BULL - Written by Mike Bartlett, Directed by David Ferry /March 17 – April 5, 2015 “So fucking icy. I could take you to a country hotel and put you in front of the fire, leave you all night, and I guarantee you’d still be as fucking frozen as you are right now. Icy, hard. Tight.” -- ThomasAt the Coal Mine Theatre798 Danforth Avenue Toronto, Ontario7:30 NightlyBreaking News:/BULL by Mike Bartlett is the Coal Mine Theatre’s first production since the smash hit The Mother Fucker With The Hat./Nasty, short and brutish, BULL is razor sharp. An a-amorality play about cutthroat office politics, that draws the audience as close as possible to witness darwinian brutality through colleagues Isobel, Tony, Thomas and their employer Carter. In this dog-eat-dog ethos it is one against two as they must compete for jobs in an economy so ruthless one be will left salivating for humanity.Arts & Life:/Mike Bartlett is a Laurence Olivier Award-winning British playwright and director whose previous works include King Charles III, An Intervention, and Cock with which Toronto audiences are familiar from 2014 production at the Theatre Centre. In conversation? Hashtag: #BullBartlettThis is the first collaboration for director David Ferry and the Coal Mine Theatre. Ferry is a Dora award winning director and actor who brings incomparable experience and talent to helm BULL. Ferry will ignite the not-to-miss flames for The Coal Mine in 2015. Follow @lazyboyhat and use hashtag #BullFerryIn antagonistic roles of a lifetime Diana Bentley and Damon Runyan star as Isobel and Tony; co-starring is Ryan Rogerson as Thomas a sharp tongued if unwilling adversary forced into battle. Tony and Isobel deploy every trick in the bully’s rule-book, and with a killer mentality move quickly to emasculate, humiliate, and undermine Thomas. Without losing a beat Mark Caven rounds out this incredible cast in the role of Carter. ///Damon Runyan, Ryan Rogerson & Diana Bentley by Shaun Benson///In conversation use #BullTO to chat with us & spread the word!Beyond the stage is a staggering team ready to create and bring this captivating play life. The Coal Mine Theatre is thrilled to work with the following artists:Erika Connor - Costume Design Rae Ellen Bodie - Dialect Coach @RaeEllenBodie/Simon Fon - Fight Director/Carrie Sager - PR @SkrappywithaK/Anna Kajtar - Producer/Sean Baker - Production Manager/Steve Lucas - Set and Lighting/Virginia Cardinal - Stage Manager/Christopher Stanton - Sound Design @onebandoflightPlease follow us, tweet us, ask us and share us with friends!Financial Post:/How a theatre can sustain longterm prosperity is complex. It will require establishing a solid reputation with the work we produce in these early months and years. As we grow we will continue to develop a strategy to support ourselves through each season. We will look to responsible corporate resources and government funding. It probably goes without saying these resources are extremely hard to come by for a new company. This campaign marks a crucial step toward our future. To continue bringing together great audiences and productions at the Coal Mine Theatre we need to ask for your support. In return we offer some great perks and this promise: We will always strive to rise you from your seats, thrill you with laughter, to challenge you with sights and sounds and reach you with inspired feeling.This $5,000 goal comes from our projected ticket sales crossed with a very modest, rock-and-roll indie theatre budget where talent is never sacrificed and quality is always worth more than a penny in the back pocket. Money raised goes toward the following:Rights - for use of the play.Lights and sound - so you may hear and see us.Props and costume - so you will believe us./Professional fees - so we will live./Publicity - so we will reach more of you.‘All the news that’s fit to print’/“Exquisitely excruciating and relentlessly brutal, a vicious comedy.” –/Time Out /"Bartlett applies his down-and-dirty, black-humored and trenchant approach to the concept of business employment as survival of the fittest…the play is like a protracted death scene among a group of wild animals, with the strong ones—a pair of smartly-dressed, smirking thugs—mercilessly circling and taunting the weak until it's time to deliver the inevitable fatal blows." —Associated Press./“I think it’s one that a lot of people have to confront every day when they get up and go to work. London is full of people who have to put on a suit, get on the tube, go to an office and win.” -- Exeuntmagazine.com//"Toronto’s indie theatre companies have given us a number of memorable, low-budget production of plays that might once have been reflexively slotted into a Canadian Stage season before it went off in its current, idiosyncratic, interdisciplinary direction. (David Ferry has been responsible for several of these passion projects.) Personally, I’m much happier with the ecology now – even if it requires theatregoers to do a little more work to find the good stuff." -- David Ferry on theatre in The Globe and Mail/Big Thanks to Friends and Colleagues of Coal Mine Theatre:Shaun Benson :: Photographer Extraordinaire :: @shaunmbensonMatt Campagna & Melissa D'Agostino :: @mattcampagna & @melissadagsThe Coal Mine is an intimate, independent theatre space run by Ted Dykstra (Artistic Curator) and Diana Bentley (Artistic Producer).
info.risks and challenges: Our challenge is the limitation of resources but with our dedication and your generousity this space will break through the noise. This production will go up March 17th rain or shine./Thank you for supporting, sharing and visiting with us. See you at The Coal Mine./Sincerely Diana Bentley and Ted Dykstra./Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

data.name: Hi, Are You Single? by Ryan J. Haddad

info.description: RYAN HAS A HIGHER SEX DRIVE THAN YOU./HE ALSO HAS CEREBRAL PALSY. Do you have a high sex drive? Ryan does. He also has cerebral palsy. No, those things are not mutually exclusive. Join writer/performer Ryan J. Haddad on a roller coaster through New York’s gay dating scene, where the highs are high and the lows are lonely. Directed by Laura Savia, Hi, Are You Single? is an examination of intimacy, rejection, and judgment. But also Grindr, fabulous drag queens, and go-go dancers. Please bring an attractive male friend with you./*//After various workshops and performances of the piece at Williamstown Theatre Festival, Dixon Place and Ohio Wesleyan University, we are excited to be able to bring Ryan's story to wider audiences. We are raising money for the upcoming performances of this show://The NYC LGBT Community Center/An Educational Tour/The Public Theater's Under The Radar Festival///// ////The creative team includes —/Director: Laura Savia/Scenic Designer: Lawrence E. Moten III Lighting Designer: Isabella F. Byrd/Producers: Sally Cade Holmes & Patti Anne Miller/I mean... how could you say "no" to this face?? ////Photo by Daniel Rader///
info.risks and challenges: One of the challenges with planning the future of this show is that there are unexpected obstacles that will inevitably pop up. We are fundraising to mitigate when that happens. We have taken care when planning to accommodate artistic fees, travel, and productions costs so we are confident that by meeting our goal we are setting ourselves up for success./An additional challenge that we hope to overcome is that many of our creative team passionately worked on the show for free during the workshop process. If this fundraising campaign succeeds, we're excited to be able to offer compensation for their tireless efforts./Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

info.description: STORY"We will fix it.We will mend it..."In the light of a pregnancy, a faithless couple pick apart their relationship, stitch by painful stitch. But is there too much damage done? This explosive play by Anthony Neilson opened at the Traverse Theatre, Edinburgh in 2nd August 2002 before being transferred to the Bush Theatre on the 12th September 2002. "Explodes with power, discipline, integrity and sheer cruel psychological accuracy... Neilson's writing has a terrible beauty" Sunday Times"Startling rich and challenging, Neilson depicts with aching precision a relation in which love is undetermined by distrust." Time Out"Shattering, shocking...a serious, persuasive account of the blind alleys love can lead us down." Daily Telegraph"A characteristically brave and brutal offering." Independent"A deeply mesmerizing, if shocking, experience as a couple smashes through taboo after taboo in a harrowing sexual tug of war." data.name: Widow's Wedding Dress

info.description: OPIA Theatre Collective seeks to marry the relationship between actor and director, playwright and performer.  Our company exists to tell the stories of those whose voices are not heard often enough.  We want to celebrate the voices of women, and by funding Widow's Wedding Dress you will be helping OPIA on her maiden voyage.   /A theatre company in its infancy such as ours often has trouble meeting the monetary demands for a production. There is the cost of theatre space, advertising, box office deductions, costuming, and paying actors to name a few. Your generous donations will go towards helping OPIA stage Widow's Wedding Dress, but 25% of box office sales will be set aside in order to ensure the profit from this production will be used to create a sustainable budget for future productions and experiments in Canadian Feminist theatre.//Widow's Wedding Dress began as a 20-minute one woman show in 2015 when it was written as a culminating project at the University of Windsor.  While the four years of training in the BFA Acting program at Windsor prepares the actor to constantly create, this project was the first of its kind.//20 minutes.  By yourself.  No limitations.  //What to write about?  Where to begin? // I have always been interested in the stories of women whose voices seemed to be drowned out by the din of their often patriarchal cultures.  From 1950s housewives, to the history of sex trade, to cultural gender roles, I can watch just about any documentary or read any book that can tell me a story about a woman in her environment.  All I had to do was choose which story to tell./That story ended up being Widow's Wedding Dress; a tale about the last generation of Irish Traveller women who were truly nomadic.  Irish Travellers, or Irish Gypsies as they are sometimes referred to, were looked down upon by both the Irish government and their fellow citizens.  Often regarded as con artists and thieves, Ireland viewed them as a problem to be solved.  The Traveller culture including fighting, feuding, death, birth, and religion has been told almost exclusively from history's point of view as the story of men.  There is very little to be said about the women in the caravans and around the campfires.  Until now.
info.risks and challenges: Just because a Kickstarter project is funded, it does not necessarily mean that the local community will support the production.  Many hours will need to go into advertising and promotion, with no real guarantee that an audience will come.  Should we face low ticket sales, an adjustment of the budget will occur to ensure that we will still have a fund to mount our next production.  Our goal is to become a sustainable feminist theatre company, not mount a single production and call it a day./Additionally, with the Canada Post strike looming, there may be a delay in delivery of items which require shipping in Canada.  Please check for updates as the strike progresses./Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

data.blurb: Set in 1950s Northern Ireland, this play tells the story of two sisters in a community of Travellers, or Irish Gypsies.

data.name: In My Head - A new mental health theatre project

info.description: IN MY HEADA new play by Chris Mayo"It's seen as a flaw, a weakness, people don't understand it, people are scared of what they can't see."Hurtling through twenty-two scenes, six actors play over forty characters in Chris Mayo's striking new play.A bold, loud, funny, angry, touching and honest portrayal of mental health in the modern world. IN MY HEAD is a part verbatim, part fictional exploration of those who struggle, those who help and those who fail to notice.We interviewed over 50 people both in person and via online surveys about their experiences of mental health conditions and have created a play that explores their stories as well as asks questions and challenges stigma.///In My Head - Proud Archivist - 9th - 14th November 2015///THE COMPANYCuckoo Bang is comprised of actor / comedian / playwright CHRIS MAYO and actor / musician / writer HOLLY MALLETT. Formed in 2013, our debut production 'Between Ten And Six' was performed at The Etc Theatre, Leicester Square Theatre and Brighton Fringe and was published by PlayDead Press. Our focus is on presenting new writing and collaborating with the best emerging actors, writers, directors, producers and creative talent in the UK. You can read more about the company and our previous work at www.cuckoobang.co.ukPLANS FOR THE SHOWOur Kickstarter campaign will cover the costs of our Autumn run at The Proud Archivist in Hackney, London from November 9th - 14th, however we have lots of plans for the show beyond that. We are making plans for future performances in London (Spring 2016), Brighton Fringe (May 2016), Edinburgh Festival (August 2016) and a potential tour of Arts Centres in Autumn 2016. Your donations will help us start the journey for the show and will be a vital part of a production we want to take to audiences across the UK.WHY ARE YOU PUTTING IT ON?We are hugely passionate about creating new work that excites, inspires and invites discussion. This is not just a 'Mental health play' but an exciting and passionate piece of new writing that raises important questions whilst still being accessible and entertaining.WHEN AND WHERE CAN WE SEE IT?The Proud Archivist, London. 9th - 14th November at 8pm. Tickets £10.We'll have ticket links and more info soon!THE COSTS We need your help to raise £3,000 to cover the basic costs of putting on a 6 night run of In My Head this Autumn. This works out as £300 -  Kickstarter's 10% fee£500 -  Venue hire£600 -   Rehearsal space£1200 - Actors performance fees£150 -  Director fee£75 -   Kickstarter rewards (Badges and posters)£175 -   Script publishing costsSTRETCH GOALSWe set our initial goal at £3000 to give us the best chance of raising the full amount and to cover the basic costs of putting on our show, the reality is there are lots of other costs involved which we hope we can raise beyond our initial target. These are called stretch goals and are as follows:STRETCH GOAL 1 - £3500If we can raise an additional £500, £300 will go to our actors who are currently working on a profit share basis. We want to pay a fair and guaranteed wage production which is only possible if we raise the extra money. £100 will cover our technicians basic expenses (they are currently working on a profit share only basis). £100 will go towards our set.STRETCH GOAL 2 - £4000An extra £200 to our actors fees, £100 towards our directors fee (who is currently working on basic expenses) and £200 towards our set costs (which will cost approx £1000)STRETCH GOAL 3 - £5000Extra fees for our actors, creative team and publicity.STRETCH GOAL 4 - £7500We can build our set and pay all our actors and creative team a decent fee for their involvement in the production.STRETCH GOAL 5 - £10000We're fit to burst with this stretch, but £10,000 covers all our costs. We can pay full fees to our actors and crew, build the full set we need which we will be able to take to all of our future venues. This will also mean we can start work on the costs involved for our Spring performances.We want you to know exactly where your money is going and we will keep you updated every step of the way!THANK YOU!We hope that gives you a good idea of the project. We're really excited to get In My Head off the ground and into theatres from this Autumn. Thank you so much for taking the time to check us out, anything you can spare is massively appreciated. If you can't donate please send the link to a friend or work colleague, tweet about us, share our info on Facebook, it all really helps and we literally couldn't do it without you!Huge thanks, we look forward to sharing In My Head with you soon.Chris and Holly xCuckoo Bangwww.cuckoobang.co.uk / @cuckoobang
info.risks and challenges: Putting on any play in London is a risky business, audiences are unpredictable, as are reviews, but we have a show we are very proud of with a subject matter that everyone can relate to and that everyone can learn from./We really believe in the work we do and are 100% passionate about it, so we will do all we can to overcome any obstacles and make In My Head a success for our company and audiences./Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

data.blurb: Inspired by real life interviews 'In My Head' is a new play exploring the lives of those living with a mental health condition.

data.name: After The End

info.description: The Let go Theatre Co are a brand new theatre company based in the heart of Glasgow. We have making accessible and challenging theatre at the core of our ideas. We feel that providing opportunities for up and coming creatives in an ever changing and challenging industry is incredibly important. We want to create an environment where directors, actors, writers, practitioners and creatives of all sorts can collaborate and work on their craft all whilst creating fantastic new theatre. "We find ourselves in the ‘bunker’ of Mark’s garden. Mark has been stocking up in the event – or, perhaps, the hope – of a nuclear disaster. Louise remembers nothing of the events that have brought her here and wonders why Mark would have gone to such lengths. ‘I kept it stocked,’ says Mark, ‘because the world’s gone fucking insane.’ That might well be the case, but it doesn’t take long for the audience – if not Louise – to work out the subtext here. If the world is insane, it is not quite as mad as Dennis Kelly’s character.Together, they create a microcosmic, claustrophobic world in which big themes – sexual politics and ideas about fascism and decadence, power and responsibility – play themselves out in a pressure cooker environment."Dylan Moore
info.risks and challenges: To be able to provide all the opportunities that we can in this first production we need to raise the minimum of £600. This covers the cost of rehearsal space, basic set and props and most importantly it covers the cost of acquiring the performance rights. /Other risks include lack of an audience which will hinder the team being paid./Failure to deliver the project due to lack of funding/As with any kind of theatre project, there are inherent risks such as cast illnesses or unforeseen production delays and we'll be relying on the skills, experience and talents of our established and hard-working team, as well as working closely with our partners and supporters, to ensure these risk are mitigated as much as possible./Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

data.blurb: Let Go Theatre Co's very first production is going ahead in June 2015. Help support a brand new theatre co as we begin our adventure

data.name: Joe West's THEATER OF DEATH

info.description: What we've done and what we hope to do!In the winter of 2014 I stumbled on a book on the history of the Grand Guignol theater. I had heard about it, its macabre history, when I was a student studying theater, but never gave it much notice. For some reason, that winter, I became a fan. I began to assemble the team that became the THEATER OF DEATH company.   Once the actors and musicians fell into place, we produced our first production which was a bit rough but ended up being a great show and we sold out the run. Shortly thereafter, in the fall, we produced THEATER OF DEATH: THE ABSINTHE PLAYS which was another SELL OUT run of shows and refreshingly a bit more "professional" and clean in its execution (We took on Joel Nicholas as a Technical Director which was a big step!).   Our upcoming third production, THE TEQUILA PLAYS, will follow the "formula" of our past productions (short plays of horror and comedy with  live original music)  but with a stronger commitment to the goal of creating awesome theater. For instance:-We are always bringing in the most talented and spirited people we can find. The company keeps getting better and better!!-With the success of this fund raising campaign, we will be going into this next show with enough money to comfortably create without having to beg and borrow (though I'm sure we will do a little). Then, along with merch sales and tickets sales, we can move into the new year with a strong enough budget to create another production (I am already talking to the company about doing a series of HORRIFIC LOVE STORIES for Valentines Day).-We will be working with a professional PUBLICIST and we will extend our reputation to the further reaches of this community. Publicity Publicity Publicity!!!Ultimate goal of mine.  I would like to see the THEATER OF DEATH become the  premier Grand Guignol theater company in this part of the world, performing not only original plays (giving an opportunity for local writers and myself to develop plays in this genre), but also revisiting classics of horror and the macabre. Like the original Grand Guignol, I like to think that this theater with its  "low brow sophistication", will thrill the poor, the working class and the social elite of Northern New Mexico and the greater Southwest.
info.risks and challenges: There are a million things that can go wrong with these shows. I think it just takes that singular vision to charge ahead no matter what the heck happens./   I think I have a strong vision and i think i inspire people. People get on board./   The 1st production may have been the hardest. I had to CONVINCE people of this idea. Now we've seen it succeed and people "get it"./Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

data.blurb: Joe West and his wonderful theater company THEATER OF DEATH present original plays both horrific and comical.

data.name: Make TES a success at The Edinburgh Fringe Fest

info.description: I am looking to bring what I consider to be socially relevant, conscious, engaging, quality, and important stories to as large an audience base as I possibly can, firstly through theatre and then hopefully in the future through TV and film./Critical to this aim is the success of 'TES - Tess of the D'Urbervilles Re-imagined' at this year's Edinburgh Fringe Festival.TES is a show that I have developed over a number of years. I toured the show last year at Canadian Fringe Festivals where it was a critical and box office success:"An Orwellian portrayal of Britain's rotting underbelly that slices like a rusty razor" Victoria Times Colonist"Bring a pocket full of tissues before you embark on this emotional journey and prepare to leave stunned and inspired by the power of Larkin’s spoken word."/Edmonton Sun "Tragic tale with humour, poetry, wordplay and enough pathos to leave the audience shaken. One of the best shows at the fringe, no doubt" Vue Magazine  ***** /This show is the pinnacle of my artistic career so far and I have high hopes for its exposure in the UK./////I have been evolving my practice over a number of years, mainly in North America, and I have developed a significant profile and following on the other side of the Atlantic.  /In the UK I am known chiefly as a promoter, a host, and an occasional poet having ploughed much time and energy into developing the Hammer & Tongue poetry slam and touring network which I created in 2003, seeing through the transition from a one-off gig to a larger network of events that lead to a National Poetry Slam Final at The Royal Albert Hall./////Opportunities to expose my own artistic talents, have been extremely limited in my country of domicile, whose spoken word scene I have served well for decades, and it feels very much as if it is high time that I announce my presence and establish my reputation as an artist in the UK.Only success at The Edinburgh Fringe Festival will achieve this aim.I am in a great position to do this with TES if I can utilize substantial resources to stand out from the crowd at Edinburgh.I have been accepted into one of the best venues - The Underbelly.  I will be performing TES every day in 'The Wee Coo' at 13:15.  This means that I will be able to perform the show in a decent theatrical environment with a good technical set up, which is extremely important to the show given that it has an audio-scape that was developed with Olivier-Award nominated West End sound designer Chris Full.The show was written for and about the UK where there is a huge amount of interest in literary heritage and I believe that given a professional job on the promotional front that it will be an intriguing show to a great number of people.TES follows the plot of Thomas Hardy's 1891 novel very closely re-inventing the main character as a teenage hoodie from a council estate who is found to be descended from a famous Romantic poet.  He suffers a similar tragic fate to that of the original Tess./Hardy's original examines philosophical or historical determinism, and the apparent impossibility of social mobility in Victorian Britain.  Everything that can go wrong for the innocent rural beauty Tess does go wrong as we witness her 'progress' from pastoral pageantry to slave-like labour in finger-bleeding mechanised farming.  Intertwined is, what is, in my opinion, one of the most beautifully written love stories of all time.  Hardy was extremely conscious of the effect of one period of history passing to another./In re-imagining the story in post-industrial Britain I have given myself the opportunity to comment or ask questions about the current political situation in the UK and I have embedded real-life stories and poetic reactions into the plot./As soon as it was conceived in 2012 I knew what I wanted it to be: a dramatic reinvention of a novel, written with a cinematic eye, that draws parallels between pre and post industrial ages, personifying injustice in a protagonist drowning in pathos. /In creating the piece I followed the original closely, finding modern-day equivalents, where Hardy paints pastoral landscapes strewn with seeds I imagined analogous symbolism to point towards the inevitable with an urban/techno soundscape./After devising a pure storytelling version of the show with the guidance of New York storyteller Martin Dockery utilising my performative instincts that have come about from many years of being noticed in bustling club environments and winning over audiences with stand up poetry I produced a    vibrant visceral script by devising the story exclusively orally with no written script.//////In early 2014 I was awarded a residency with Underconstruction Theatre and had the benefit of working with the extremely talented dramaturge Lizzy McBain.  She gave me much more direction and had a great impact on the piece with vital theatrical developments to characterization and blocking.  /////I worked with the amazing Chris Full to create the immersive 3D audio-scape. In doing this I was able to realise the initial vision and fully realise the aim of creating a unique and professional theatre show.The residency also involved me writing a blog about the progress of the development:http://scratch.underconstructiontheatre.com/theatre-scratch-residency-day-1/and a video trailer being produced for the show by Ricky Tart of Tricky Arts:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gYiWT-f22QI/I then toured the show for three months in Canada.  Canada was expensive to get to and to tour around so there was no significant financial gain but it gave me the opportunity for editing and polishing through performing the piece every other night in front of audiences.It also resulted in fantastic press.  At the Edmonton International Fringe Festival (the biggest in North America) it got the best overall star ratings of any show./////http://www.edmontonsun.com/2014/08/17/fringe-review-tesI have never been in a better position to impress the theatrical world.  So much work has gone into this piece of spoken word theatre. I believe I have created, with help from others, a unique piece of art.  If I have the opportunity to invite people into this world that I have created it will lead on I'm sure.I have ambitions to take this on and create a film or TV mini-series version of TES.  Edinburgh is the best place to start conversations about such potential collaboration.This is  only likely to occur if I have the resources to have professional PR and mount a thorough publicity campaign.With no tickets sold Edinburgh could set me back somewhere in the region of £10K:Venue Guarantee: £2251.01/Venue Programme Entries: £600.00/Fringe Registration Fee: £393.60/Professional PR: £3500.00/Print / Distribution: £1500.00/Accomodation: £1400.00/Subsistence: £400.00Total: £10044.00I would like to go to Edinburgh focused on performing the show to the best of my ability and networking far and wide.  The success of this kickstarter campaign will enable me to do just that.
info.risks and challenges: I’m going no matter what.  With your help, after the tour I’ll be sending out DVDs instead of credit card payments!/The bigger risk is not being noticed at all by press and programmers.  Also a risk is the fact that I am doing a serious drama that runs for 75 minutes at a fringe where a great number of people are looking for fun shows and comedies that last no more than an hour./There is an audience for serious theatre in Edinburgh and the above risks only point towards the need for the best PR and publicity package that I can get together to ensure that audiences are exposed to my work and to ensure that the theatre industry takes notice of what I have to offer./Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

data.blurb: Years of work, my best show, and a top Edinburgh venue.  Help me expose my talents to the UK and tell an important story.

data.name: MTA's National Theatre Connections Show!

info.description: Montage Theatre Arts are a small local charity which provides theatre training in Lewisham, one of the most deprived boroughs in London, and we need YOUR help to fund our National Theatre Connections project!- Venue Hire- Set- Props- Costume- Make UpThese all come at a cost, can you help to raise funds for this incredible project?WHY FUND US?!We are a small local charity which provides theatre training in one of the most deprived boroughs in London; Lewisham. Supported by the generosity of others, the local council and other foundations and trusts, we provide people ages 3 to 93 with fun, community-orientated development and vocational training. National Theatre Connections is a project for which we receive no external funding. The National Theatre kindly granted us a bursary to avoid the cost of taking part in the project, but no other monies are forthcoming.While some children do pay a fee to join the project (which covers the cost of a director, any assistants and rehearsal rooms), others pay a much reduced concession rate. Many of our students however, are awarded a scholarship to attend the rehearsals, for reasons ranging from their families financial situation to being young carers and deserving the opportunity to go out and do something they love.We believe in the transformative nature of the arts; we have seen these students grow under our director by developing essential skills including increased empathy, personal presence and public speaking. NT CONNECTIONS: WHAT IS THAT?!National Theatre Connections is an initiative run by the National Theatre to help young theatre makers (13 - 18) experience a professional theatre environment.The project has 3 main stages:1. Development! In October 2015, a group of 19 young students began developing a play; I'm Spilling my Heart Out Here by Stacey Gregg. This has involved collaborative rehearsals with their director Florence O'Mahony, learning script, creating characters and much more!2. Home Performances! At the end of February 2016, this talented bunch of students will perform this 45 minute play three times. This can be in any performance venue, and MTA have been lucky to secure the Tramshed in Woolwich and the MCT at Alleyn's School-  but venues like this don't come cheap, despite the very kind rates offered to us as a local charity.At one of these performances an NT Connections director will watch, and give feedback from the performance.3. Greenwich Theatre Performance! On 20th March 2016, MTA students will 'tread the boards' at Greenwich Theatre, performing before another NT Connections representative and a public audience. This is an amazing opportunity for young people to step onto a professional 'main stage' developing as performers and young adults.4. On to the National Theatre?! One organisation is chosen from each play selection to perform at the National Theatre... watch this space!A BIT ABOUT THE PLAY!It’s the daily scramble across no-man’s-land: you flinch as you pass those even more clueless than you, strewn from the barbed wire of exams, first dates, evil former best mates... /but hell’s ok if you stick together. Join Montage Theatre Arts and the NT Connections group as they perform 'I'm Spilling my Heart Out' by Stacey Gregg. The play is suitable for those over 12, unless parental discretion dictates otherwise (some light violence/gore and 2 or 3 sexual references).TICKETS:27th February:7pm - The TramshedGreenwich & Lewisham Young People’s Theatre, 51-53 Woolwich New Road, London, SE18 6ES/Link: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/mta-nt-connections-im-spilling-my-heart-out-here-tramshed-tickets-20972770120/28th February:/1.30pm - The MCT at Alleyn'sTownley Road East Dulwich SE22 8SULink: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/mta-nt-connections-im-spilling-my-heart-out-here-alleyns-matinee-tickets-21029151759/6pm  - The MCT at Alleyn'sTownley Road East Dulwich SE22 8SU Link: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/mta-youth-drama-festival-nt-connections-im-spilling-my-heart-out-here-alleyns-tickets-21030003306
info.risks and challenges: We don't foresee any critical challenges or risks facing the project./If the cast is unable to perform for some reason, the performances can be rescheduled and continue as planned./Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

data.blurb: Montage Theatre Arts, as part of National Theatre Connections, are performing a show - We need you help to raise vital funds!

data.name: Macbeth

info.description: A drum, a drum...Old Hat Theatre Company is thrilled to present Macbeth, our first production of 2016. Performances will run May 13th-28th at St. Paul’s Theater in Brooklyn. / Knock, knock, knock. Who's there?Founded in 2011, Old Hat is a Brooklyn-based classical theater company comprised of actors, academics, designers, musicians, and writers. Our diverse artistic backgrounds are reflected in our work. We are dedicated to producing Shakespeare and other classical works in fresh, imaginative ways while remaining faithful to the original texts, whose richness makes them a limitless source of inspiration. /Our past projects include Hamlet, Twelfth Night, and original adaptations of Chekhov short stories. We have staged productions in interesting spaces around Brooklyn, from an old public bathhouse in Gowanus to a parlor in a 19th-century townhouse on Prospect Park West. Macbeth will go up in the recently restored St. Paul’s Theater in Williamsburg.  We are excited for the opportunity to expand our audience and community.  / By the pricking of my thumbs...Our Macbeth production is set in a surreal landscape inspired by the bleak and treacherous no-man's-land of World War I. We explore the loneliness and distorted morality that emerge from a culture of violence; how war and murder may blur and deform one's very sense of self.  These themes in the play are always resonant and timely, as war and loss are always present in the world. /"Cruel are the times when we are traitors / And do not know ourselves ...But float upon a violent sea / Each way and move." / Thou wouldst be great!This project is about more than a single production. It marks some important firsts for Old Hat, which will help us become a sustained positive artistic force in the Brooklyn community and beyond. This will be our first three-week performance run, which will increase our visibility and introduce us to a larger, more diverse audience.  The additional performances will increase our income, enabling us to move quickly into our next production. For the first time, we will engage the local community through subsidized tickets for students, Q & As with the cast and crew, and open rehearsal workshops.  These programs will be developed and augmented over future productions and with our first student workshops coming this summer. We feel it is vital for young people to discover and stay connected to the wisdom of great literature and for all people to have access to affordable classical theater. But to do all this, we need your help!/We have secured a space, dates, a tremendous cast, and production is under way. There are many areas that need your support.  Your gift of any sum can make a tremendous difference: / /$50 subsidizes three tickets for Brooklyn students/$100 prints our programs or underwrites our sound equipment/$250 rents a week’s worth of rehearsal space/$500 funds our educational programming/$1,000 builds our set or costumes our company /Open locks, whoever knocks!Your contribution will bring Macbeth to life, and it will help to make our greater mission sustainable. The opportunity here is for you to help Old Hat Theatre Company grow, to be a part of a force for cultural good. We are a group who wants to do classical theater because it’s good for the world. It’s good to confront political ideas and illuminate profound psychology and poetry, to promote analysis and literacy and debate, to invite everyone to recognize themselves in these great and timeless stories. We ask you to support us now, so we can take a leap forward with this Macbeth production and do our work more often, in more places, for more people. Thank you for your contribution!
info.risks and challenges: Producing theater in NYC – and getting people to notice – is always a challenge, but we have the advantages of experience and a supportive community. With your funding and support, we're confident that our efforts to bring the production to the Brooklyn community and beyond will be successful./Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

data.blurb: Old Hat's new production explores the bleak culture of war and the cosmic powers of guilt and imagination in Shakespeare's tragedy.

data.name: MEASURE FOR MEASURE: an all-female adaptation

info.description: The eccentric Duke of Vienna leaves Lord Angelo in charge of his city while he disguises himself as a friar. Lord Angelo uses this as an opportunity to rid the city of the one thing everybody hates: Sex. / /In this ninety-minute adaptation of the classic Shakespeare play, a cast of ten women asks the question: What even is virginity anyway?ABOUT THE PRODUCTIONIn Elizabethan times, it was illegal for women to be on stage. Consequently, most plays consisted of a male-centric story line and the token female characters were played by men dressed as women. Since then, the English-speaking world (and many other worlds) has continued the tradition of writing plays about men featuring mostly male casts. In 2016, I have made the directorial decision for it to be illegal for men to be on my Elizabethan stage. My name is Lizz (that's where the wordplay for "Elizabethan" comes in!) and I humbly ask you to consider donating to help me make up for hundreds of years of lack of female representation on stage.WHY MEASURE FOR MEASUREWhile the Duke is "away," Lord Angelo tries to shut down all of the brothels and behead anyone caught fornicating out of wedlock, no matter how consensual it is. Claudio has been discovered to have knocked up his girlfriend and is sent to prison. His sister, who is studying to become a nun, tries to appeal to Angelo like a rational human being and in turn he will only agree to let her brother free if she yields her virginity to him.Basically, the whole play is about men getting upset over what women can or cannot do with their own bodies. Performing it with an all-female cast dressed like men? Hilarious.ABOUT THE NYC WOMEN'S WORK FESTIVALPresented by WEBroadway, The Women's Work Festival is a week-long showcase of full-length plays and musicals written/adapted by women. We will be taking over the Playroom Theater in midtown from June 22nd-26th (Measure for Measure will be on June 24th and 25th). On average, the divide between writers on Broadway (including book writers, composers, and lyricists) is around 90% male, 10% female./On average, the people purchasing tickets to Broadway shows are around 70% female. If women are buying the tickets, why aren’t we letting women tell the stories?For more information on the Women's Work Festival and WEBroadway please visit webroadway.org (which is also where you can buy your tickets!)We have a wonderful cast of 10 women who deserve proper rehearsal space, costumes, and props. Theater is expensive. I humbly ask that you consider donating towards this passion project of ours.And let us make you laugh!
info.risks and challenges: I cannot stress enough how expensive theater is. If we rehearse 3 hours a day for three weeks in an actual rehearsal studio instead of outside in the rain it will cost about $1000. If we get this fully funded, we will still have to rely on finding free props and costumes. Every little bit helps./Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

data.blurb: In this ninety-minute adaptation of the classic Shakespeare play, a cast of nine women asks the question: What even is virginity anyway

data.name: All the Best, Jack

info.description: The production of All the Best, Jack we are putting together serves as the thesis project for director and playwright Chelsea Anderson to earn her MFA in Theatre from the University of Wisconsin-Madison. It is a project already more than two years in the making with a live production being the next big step in its creation. In order to make that happen, we need your help. Tickets are free for this October production--that's right: FREE. Your donation to this fund helps us to cover the production costs to create a professional, enjoyable experience at no cost to our audience. Consider your gift as the cost of your ticket. Whether you attend a performance or not (and we hope you do!), you are affording many community members the opportunity to see a live theatre production when they may not have the opportunity to do so with skyrocketing ticket prices on many professional shows. Anything you are able to donate will help us reach our goal. We cannot thank you enough for supporting our endeavors and live theatre in general. Please visit our website or check us out on Twitter @NovaLightArt for more information about this project and other upcoming public works. THANK YOU for your help.
info.risks and challenges: Theatre productions can run into many issues in their creation stage, particularly with a new, untested play. Having successfully produced two well received original plays in the past, our director Chelsea Anderson is very familiar with the pitfalls of getting a production on its feet. This time around, we have a professional, creative group of designers who are used to the challenges of a small budget and limited resources. We have a cast of actors who can rise to any occasion and make reading the telephone book compelling. And with your generous donation, we can do so much more./Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

data.blurb: This play tells the story of the toxicity of sensationalism shown through one man's struggle with notoriety.

data.name: The Rules: Sex, Lies & Serial Killers

info.description: This August Team Sprocket will be leaving these London shores in order to break our Edinburgh Fringe seal with devilishly funny new play THE RULES: SEX, LIES & SERIAL KILLERS - and we need your help to get us there!Who we are: Lila Whelan - writer, Jez Pike - director, Isabel Dixon - associate producer, Suneeda Maruthiyil - designer, Alex Pearson - stage managerCast: Catherine Nix-Collins, Neil Chinneck, Ben Higgins and Lila Whelan./////Glad you asked! Toying with our current gleeful obsession with TV anti-heroes (House of Cards, Breaking Bad, Dexter, The Wire), THE RULES is a deliciously deviant imagining of what serial killers get up to behind closed doors. It's a dark, sexy and brilliantly funny play that's so original it quite possibly creates its own genre; the blackly comic serial-killer romance. Full of quick-fire dialogue, believably-grounded characters and mischievous twists, THE RULES manages to be both a devilish roller-coaster ride and a truthful rendering of love in the most unlikely places./////Psychopaths Jay, Mel and Steven meet up once in a while to unwind, hang up their guns and let their hair down - within a few guidelines established for their protection and anonymity of course.//But when the innocent Teresa enters their world, loyalties are tested and the rules start to get broken, one by one. And when serial killers break the rules, the consequences can be a little...messy.//But hey, rules are made to be broken, aren't they?//////First up the show is genuinely awesome and you're going to love it. /Secondly because Sprocket makes thrillingly original theatre that moves, haunts, challenges and - most importantly - entertains. We say boo to the boring and the pretentious and the over-reliance on celebrity-fronted stuffy old plays that colours London’s West End. ///Thirdly, we are on a mission to provide more roles for women and so all of our productions consist of at least 50% women (on and off stage)./Fourthly, in every production we engage and support new and emerging talent./Finally, Edinburgh is just the start of our journey with The Rules - with your help we can make it a huge success up north and then the world's our oyster!//////The money you'll donate will go lovingly towards hiring a rehearsal space for 4 weeks (£600), printing flyers and posters (£200), buying props and costumes (£250), creating the set (£350), transporting all of that lot (£50), along with our eight-person team (£550), up to Edinburgh!**and maybe back down again if they're well behaved./////Okey doke! On Wednesday 15 July we'd like to invite everyone who's donated £10 or more to attend THE RULES launch party Pub Quiz night with our cast and crew. //Where: the Reliance Pub, 336 Old St, London EC1V 9DR www.thereliancepub.co.uk///When: 15 July, doors open at 6.15pm ///Tickets can be bought by pledging on our Kickstarter/There'll be fantastic raffle prizes up for grabs, a pub quiz with special serial-killer flavoured round with a tip-top secret prize (it is GOOD!) and generally lots of rowdy fun to send us off on our way.Prizes to be announced - keep checking back!/////We've been working tirelessly on this show since 2013, from it's earliest infancy with a showcase at the Old Red Lion Theatre in 2013 right through to a series of workshops and rehearsed readings in 2014 and 2015.2013 reviews/////2015 rehearsed reading:///////You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.//////Play////////////////////////////Replay with sound//////////Play with  sound/////////////00:00///00:00////////////////////////////////2014 rehearsed reading:///////You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.//////Play////////////////////////////Replay with sound//////////Play with  sound/////////////00:00///00:00////////////////////////////////With thanks to the talents of Abigail Pickard Price, Keira Duffy, James Thorne, Ruth McMeel, Cameron Harle, Charlie Haskins, Rob Welling and Natasha Killam.Previous workSprocket's 2013 debut production THE DEEP SPACE///Reviews//////////London Previews: 20 & 21 July @ 7pm, Theatre503, 503 Battersea Park Road, SW11 3BW Edinburgh: 7 - 22 August @ 21:50, 24 - 29 August @ 20:35, theSpace on the Mile, Edinburgh
info.risks and challenges: Our risks mainly consist of reaching our fundraising target! /Making theatre is an exciting and risky business but we're prepared for everything Edinburgh can through at us (including the weather) and we're already a good half way through our fundraising endeavours - we just need that extra support from you to reach our goal./Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

data.blurb: The Rules is a brand new black-comedy, serial-killer-romance debuting at the Edinburgh Fringe this August and we need your help!

data.name: HELP BUILD "THE CASTLE"

info.description: WE NEED YOUR HELP to BUILD THE CASTLE !!!'Howard Barker is the Shakespeare of our Age' - Sarah KaneThe Red One Collective (Best Small Theatre Company, Now Magazine, Toronto), acclaimed Director Dean Gabourie (Stratford Festival, ACME Theatre Co.), and some of Canada's most accomplished Theatre Talents have gathered together to mount a production of World renowned playwright Howard Barker's, rarely produced,'The Castle'. This is a co-operative production (The Castle Collective) - fees and actors wages are split from the profits at the door.We are seeking $ 3500.00 (CAD) to help with the fee's for the rights to mount the play ($2500) and some production specific Design elements($1000) so that these fees don't come out of the actors pockets.The Storefront Theatre is not subsidized by public funding.Even a small donation will go a long way to help realize our goal  : )The CastleThe men have returned to The Castle to find it overrun by rampant feminism and sapphic love.  Ideas in conflict and words run wild.  The Castle questions power, gender, sexuality, race & religion in Barker's classic explosive style.  The Castle is more relevant today then when it was first produced in 1985.Below are some of the Talents involved!Benjamin Blais, Mark Burgess, Brenhan Mc Kibben, Lynne Griffin,/Katherine Belyea, Mike Dufays, Holly Lloyd, Michael Spencer Davis,/Dean Gabourie, Linda Diane Prystawska, Sean Sullivan, Claire Hill,/Melissa Joakim, Joshua Browne, Harry Thomas, Stacey Turner, Claire Burns, Erin Fleck, John Gundy, Marcelle Faucher, Erin Fleck, Sarah Fairlie, Dimitar Pentchev///gorgeous and talented
